transcription: going to turn to the wave of shoot Downs in the wake of the Chinese spy balloon three more flying objects taken down over the weekend off the coast of Alaska over Canada and Port Huron in Michigan Chief Global Affairs anchor Martha raddatz is tracking the story good morning Martha Good morning George if you're asking yourself why there are suddenly so many unidentified objects flying around you are not alone but after that giant Chinese spy balloon crossed over the U.S the administration is taking no chances and has adjusted the radar to catch smaller objects that may enter North American airspace this morning questions mounting after more unidentified objects discovered over U.S and Canadian airspace a third mystery object in just three days shot down by a U.S fighter jet over Lake Huron Sunday afternoon according to a senior Administration official this latest object was octagonal in shape unmanned and traveling near sensitive sites at an altitude of twenty thousand feet posing a civilian Flight Risk first detected Saturday as it flew over Montana President Biden giving the order to shoot it down once it reappeared on radar out of an abundance of caution and at the recommendation of military leaders we have been more closely scrutinizing our airspace at these altitudes including enhancing our radar which may at least partly explain the increase in objects that we've detected over the past week this latest air defense operation coming just 20 24 hours after another object was spotted over Canada's Yukon U.S and Canadian officials ordering it shot down it represented a reasonable threat to civilian aircraft Canadian and American fighter jets were scrambled and an American F-22 successfully shot down the object and that incident coming just one unidentified object was shot down off the coast of Alaska three incidents in less than a week after that Chinese spy balloon was shot down off the Carolina coast but a senior U.S official saying these three are different from that spine balloon none appear to have a payload and all are smaller it doesn't mean that they are coming from another country it doesn't even mean that there are more of them we're just looking for them and so we're finding more of them now intensive search efforts underway recovery teams in Alaska using Navy p-8 planes and helicopters as officials scrambled to recover and analyze those objects what a senior official told me late last night was that even though these latest objects have yet to be recovered they feel confident they were not spy balloons but rather some sort of meteorological balloon although officially George the administration is not even calling them balloons at this point just unidentified objects George it is some situation well hey there GMA fans Robin Roberts here thanks for checking out our YouTube channel lots of great stuff here so go on click the Subscribe button right over right over here to get more of Awesome videos and content from GMA every day anytime we thank you for watching and we'll see you in the morning on GMA

title: Many LA County areas getting snow for the first time in a long time
description: Snow is hitting at lower elevations and more is on the way. Jeff Nguyen shows us the areas that normally don't get snow blanketed in flurries.

SUZIE: JEFFREY NGUYEN CONTINUES OUR STORM WATCH TEAM COVERAGE LIVE IN BURBANK NOW. MY MOM IS GOING TO WATCH OUR DOGS OVER THE WEEKEND REPORTER: THERE'S A CHANCE WE MAY SEE MORE SNOWFALL AT LOWER ELEVATIONS AS THE STORM CONTINUES. JIM IS PREPARING AS BEST HE CAN FOR MORE RAIN. BETWEEN THE PREVIOUS STORM AND NOW ALL THIS IS NEW TARPS. title: Filipino-Americans serving in U.S. military retrace roots in PH
description:
The 4th of July is a big holiday for Americans as they celebrate their Independence Day.
In the Philippines, July 4 is also Filipino-American Friendship Day. One way to highlight the long-standing Philippine-U.S. alliance is to share the stories of Filipino-Americans serving in the U.S. military.
transcription: when USS Blue Ridge made a port call in Manila in March really excited to be here my first time in the Philippines wasn't just the ship's Captain who seemed drilled the U.S Navy warship the oldest in its fleet has more than 600 crew members two in every 10 has Filipino lineage and some were coming home for the first time in years Jason natosis's family migrated to the states in 1985. he never had the chance to return since [Music] like most U.S warships blue ridge's visit aimed to enhance Naval diplomacy with an Allied country it was also an opportunity for its Filipino American or Phil and crew to reconnect with family and friends the one Sailors tell me that their families driving six hours to come see them because they haven't seen him in so long I grew up 14 years in the Philippines so for me home is the Philippines and being stationed in Asia you know it's just an opportunity to get closer to home and visit as often as I can and while they have spent most of their lives in the U.S um these field arms remain proud of their Filipino ancestry Filipinos are known to be family oriented you know and they really work hard to get that success that you want the feel I'm scared either Filipino Heritage like a badge of honor this they say makes them endearing to Americans Filipinos are known not only to be hard working but also hospitable this ship is the most sophisticated in the US Navy for uh communication films like those with other racial backgrounds are grateful there is diversity in the U.S military the Filipino camaraderie on the ship is definitely one of a kind um in the Navy we work together a lot and we look out for each other as much as we can given the two countries long history as allies it is no surprise that many Filipinos and Americans continue to get along well especially in securing their Mutual interests David Santos CNN Philippines

title: China's position on political settlement of Ukraine crisis
description:
For  more:
https://news.cgtn.com/news/2023-02-24/China-s-position-on-political-settlement-of-Ukraine-crisis-1hG7EFKvING/index.html

China published a statement on its position on the political settlement of the Ukraine crisis on Friday, calling for respecting the sovereignty of all countries and saying the Cold War mentality should be abandoned.
#china #russia #ukraine #russiaukrainecrisis

transcription: China calls on respecting the sovereignty of all countries he said the sovereignty and territorial Integrity of all countries must be upheld the statement says the world needs to abandon the Cold War mentality and that countries should ease hostilities towards one another is stress that dialogue is the only viable solution to the Ukraine crisis and cause for peace talks to resume China also says working to result the humanitarian crisis should be a priority and that humanitarian issues should not be politicized China says parties to the conflict should strictly abide by the international humanitarian law avoid attacking civilians and respect the basic rights of prisoners of War China opposes armed attacks against nuclear power plants or are there peaceful nuclear facilities and avoid a nuclear accidents China stresses nuclear war must not be fault China caused on all parties to implement the Black Sea great initiative and support the UN in this endeavor and China says unilateral sanctions only creates new problems and imposes a unilateral sanctions unauthorized by the UN Security Council China says all parties should earnestly maintain the existing World economic system and oppose using the world economy as a toll or weapon for political purposes the statement calls on the International Community to support post-conflict reconstruction in Conflict zones China stands ready to provide assistance and play a constructive role in this endeavor

title: Visit to the Chinese People’s Liberation Army Navy (PLAN) Flagship - Destroyer ‘Chang Chun’ 5/1/2017
description:
Sasa Port, Davao City
May 1, 2017

President Rodrigo Roa Duterte inspected the Chinese People’s Liberation Army Navy (PLAN) Flagship – Destroyer ‘Chang Chun’ (DDG150) docked at Sasa Port in Davao City.

A total of three Chinese vessels were docked at Sasa Port — PLAN ships ‘Chang Chun’ (DDG 150), ‘Jin Zhou’ (FFG 532), and ‘Chan Hu’ (Supply Ship).

The goodwill visit also aimed to enhance military exchanges and mutual trust between China and the Philippines.

During the visit, the Chief Executive inspected the following stations of the vessel: 1st Station – Conference Room where a brief introduction of the PLAN Task Group (PTG) by Admiral Miao took place; 2nd Station – Foredeck (Missile and Main Gun); 3rd Station – Operations Room (Command and Control System); and the 4th station – the Bridge (Navigation System).

After the President’s inspection, he was invited to sign the ship’s guestbook and was given a wooden badge and a hat as a gift of honor.

The three vessels were docked at Sasa Port on April 30, 2017 and are scheduled to depart on May 2, 2017.

title: Turkey-Syria: Hundreds of thousands exposed to diseases & toxins
description:
The number of people killed by the earthquakes that struck Turkey and Syria earlier this month has now passed 50,000, according to the latest figures from both countries.

In Turkey alone, 44,218 people died as a result of the earthquakes, the country’s Disaster and Emergency Management Authority (AFAD) said on Friday, while the latest announced death toll in Syria was 5,914.

transcription: health workers and ngos are stepping up their operations and Quake hit regions of Southern turkey with growing concerns about the spread of infectious diseases Hashem reports from a Race Against Time to clear the rubble and Mirage is among the Region's hardest hit by earthquakes in southern turkey drinking water isn't safe the air is thick with dust and health experts say it's contaminated with toxins and pollutants from the rubble our biggest challenge in improving hygiene and sanitary conditions especially now that you have a growing number of displaced living in tents and camps our goal is to provide better living conditions for them in this makeshift Camp those without homes receive bottled water masks hand sanitizers and daily supplies of food clearly traumatized they face an uncertain future teams clear the rubble huge challenges are piling up the hundreds of thousands of people affected by the earthquakes will stay in shelters or relocated to safer houses until theirs are rebuilt but in the meantime they will continue to be exposed to the threats of aftershocks diseases and toxins in the air David whitwick leads a team of doctors from the UK and he's worried it's inevitable that you're going to see a rise in disease and it's also inevitable there will be some kind of infectious disease the only issue is how quickly we can get on top of it all together and control it for now people in karaman marash are desperate to retrieve their belongings this is all volunteers could recover from this building a photo album for the family that once lived here but they hope it will help survivors and relatives of those who have died to pick up the pieces and move on marash let's get the latest on efforts in Turkey a now I can speak to Rob McBride who is live in the city of Adana we know the government has been under huge profit pressure to provide shelter for people how is that going are people getting the help they need yeah that is the effort now to build these uh temporary container cities as they're called in the disaster affected area but there is also a growing awareness here about the pop the problem of population displacement you've had this disaster affecting literally millions of people it's estimated several million people have actually left this corner of turkey eight for other parts of the country now many of those people will have gone to the much bigger cities like Istanbul and Ankara but a sizable proportion of people will have gone not that far away from their home provinces to places like here Adena on the edge of the earthquake zone and also other cities further west down the coast for example the big Port City of Madison now that is about the first big city you come to which is considered safe if you like it's just outside of the earthquake zone so it's estimated and some of the these estimates do vary but it's reckoned that maybe several hundred thousand people have suddenly arrived within the past couple of weeks which is a big influence blocks of people for a provincial City so it's putting a real strain on resources in places like uh like Marcin we know that many of those people who are being accommodated in temporary accommodation in gymnasiums in government dormitories and so on they will return to their home provinces once temporary the places are built for them there but increasingly it seems the people who've lost livelihoods who've lost their homes may never go back and you are seeing things like rental prices in Mars in double in some cases they are expecting to see a big demand for Hospital resources for school places and so on as the population suddenly swells so places like Mars in other cities especially close to the earthquake affected area are all facing these problems and it's a big problem for turkey itself looking at the recovery not just during the emergency stage but further on into the medium and long term okay Rob McBride there for us in Adana in Turkey

title: International Law | Diplomatic Immunity Explained | Vienna Convention | Lex Animata | Hesham Elrafei
description:
What is Diplomatic Immunity? 

#law #internationallaw #education #politics 

By Hesham Elrafei 
https://www.linkedin.com/in/heshamelrafei 

This video explains  the inviolability of diplomats and envoys in International Law and their immunity from court jurisdiction as per the Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations (1961 ) . Immunity of the embassy Premises & properties,  like the buildings, , Vehicles, Archives, and Communications .Immunity of the personnel working in the embassy , which entails the  Diplomatic envoys and their  families and other admin and technical staff.

Linkedin: lnkdin.me/mido  
Twitter : https://twitter.com/law_visualizer
transcription: the inviolability of diplomats is one of the oldest rules of international law during the greek empire an envoy was not to be maltreated and could not be arrested or detained in modern days diplomatic immunity from court jurisdiction became accepted as a rule of international law with the main objective to ensure the effective performance of diplomatic functions which prevents the hosting authority from intervening with the diplomat work the diplomatic immunity is divided in two categories first immunity of the embassy premises and properties like the buildings vehicles archives and diplomatic communications while the hosting authority has a duty to protect the diplomatic premises against any damage the embassy remains immune from any law enforcement measures as the police is not allowed to enter the embassy except to protect human life in case of extreme emergency a notable example was the shooting incident at the libyan embassy in london where the uk continued to respect the inviolability of the embassy despite the shooting of a police officer by a bullet fired from within the premises the second type is the immunity of the personnel working in the embassy from local court's jurisdiction which means that the diplomat is absolutely immune from any form of law enforcement like arrest detention and search in addition to immunities the envoy and his family also enjoy certain privileges in the hosting country as the embassy is exempt from paying taxes except the payment for services like electricity or water bills and the diplomat is also exempt from baggage inspection unless there are serious grounds that his baggage contains prohibited or illegal materials on the other side privileges and immunities can also apply to non-diplomatic personnel those are the admin and technical foreign staff who enjoy limited immunity from civil jurisdiction for actions only performed at work while non-diplomatic employees resident in the receiving territory they do not get any privileges or immunities the diplomatic immunity can only be waived by the sending government otherwise the hosting country can declare the envoy a persona non-grata

title: International Law | Diplomatic Immunity Explained | Vienna Convention | Lex Animata | Hesham Elrafei
description:
What is Diplomatic Immunity? 

#law #internationallaw #education #politics 

By Hesham Elrafei 
https://www.linkedin.com/in/heshamelrafei 

This video explains  the inviolability of diplomats and envoys in International Law and their immunity from court jurisdiction as per the Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations (1961 ) . Immunity of the embassy Premises & properties,  like the buildings, , Vehicles, Archives, and Communications .Immunity of the personnel working in the embassy , which entails the  Diplomatic envoys and their  families and other admin and technical staff.

Linkedin: lnkdin.me/mido  
Twitter : https://twitter.com/law_visualizer
transcription: the inviolability of diplomats is one of the oldest rules of international law during the greek empire an envoy was not to be maltreated and could not be arrested or detained in modern days diplomatic immunity from court jurisdiction became accepted as a rule of international law with the main objective to ensure the effective performance of diplomatic functions which prevents the hosting authority from intervening with the diplomat work the diplomatic immunity is divided in two categories first immunity of the embassy premises and properties like the buildings vehicles archives and diplomatic communications while the hosting authority has a duty to protect the diplomatic premises against any damage the embassy remains immune from any law enforcement measures as the police is not allowed to enter the embassy except to protect human life in case of extreme emergency a notable example was the shooting incident at the libyan embassy in london where the uk continued to respect the inviolability of the embassy despite the shooting of a police officer by a bullet fired from within the premises the second type is the immunity of the personnel working in the embassy from local court's jurisdiction which means that the diplomat is absolutely immune from any form of law enforcement like arrest detention and search in addition to immunities the envoy and his family also enjoy certain privileges in the hosting country as the embassy is exempt from paying taxes except the payment for services like electricity or water bills and the diplomat is also exempt from baggage inspection unless there are serious grounds that his baggage contains prohibited or illegal materials on the other side privileges and immunities can also apply to non-diplomatic personnel those are the admin and technical foreign staff who enjoy limited immunity from civil jurisdiction for actions only performed at work while non-diplomatic employees resident in the receiving territory they do not get any privileges or immunities the diplomatic immunity can only be waived by the sending government otherwise the hosting country can declare the envoy a persona non-grata

title: Camp Viking – the UK commandos' new Arctic operations base
description:
Britain's commandos have a new Arctic operations base for the next 10 years.

Camp Viking in the north of Norway will act as a hub for Royal Marines as they perform their duties as the tip of the Arctic spear – the unit Britain turns to when it needs troops able to fight in extreme cold.

The camp, which offers modern facilities in the village of Øverbygd, about 40 miles south of Tromsø, is beside a Norwegian armed forces base and close to the established air base at Bardufoss where the Commando Helicopter Force operates.

More: https://www.forces.net/services/royal-marines/inside-camp-viking-new-arctic-operations-base-uk-commandos

#forcesnews #royalmarines #royalnavy #arctic #norway 

Subscribe to Forces News: http://bit.ly/1OraazC
Check out our website: http://forces.net
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ForcesTV
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/forcesnews/?hl=en
Twitter: https://twitter.com/ForcesNews

Camp Viking it's not just a training base this is strategically placed in this area of scold as part of the defense partner in the nation's defense concept the Arctic Circle of latitude is around at 66.5 degrees north of the equator and runs straight through Norway boulderforce is where the Royal Marines used to work out of and where Commando helicopter 4 still operate from Camp Viking is about an hour East near schold which is also near a Norwegian Armed Forces base it means UK troops can rapidly respond to any security threats in the region and act as a deterrent to adversaries in the high North the Royal Marine's been training in Norway for over 50 years the commitment as a capable Force operating in the high North hasn't really changed however having a large scale Force concentrated in one area is probably the main subtle difference we've come biking rather than split across multiple company areas with his large Force and and commitment over the next 10 years this will see an increased investment in infrastructure both by the UK and the Norwegian forces to grow this Camp so it's even more capable more efficient and future proof as we increase our commitment over here as for personnel when they're not in the field as well as classroom-based training some low-level Tactical tactical training can take place here too for some it could be their first time in Norway so it's about building up skills gradually here Commandos are going through the motions of getting in and out of the Viking vehicle because if not worked with the vehicle before they need to understand the safety implications of working with a vehicle and also in a tactical scenario you need to understand how they can get out securely produce that 360 degree protection around the vehicle is so we've got a couple methods which we use so we've got like the garage method where they can line out either side or if we're working a more tactically at night we can then do an Arctic cuddle so they're basically a lot closer together they've got interlocking legs just so that they all know that everyone's within that huddle and so it means when to move off they're closer together the next person know when they need to move it's a busy camp with various courses and winter Warfare training going on this hanger is used to saw weapons equipment and vehicles and it's temperature regulated so even title: China's Maritime Militias in the South China Sea
description:
The South China Sea is the most contested piece of geography on the planet. CSIS's Greg Poling explains how China uses maritime militias to intimidate its neighbors and assert its claim over the South China Sea. #Satellite #CSIS #China

Learn more at https://amti.csis.org

---------------------------------------------------------------------

Subscribe to our channel: http://cs.is/2dCfTve

CSIS is the world's #1 defense and national security think tank. Visit http://www.csis.org to find more of our work as we bring bipartisan solutions to the world's greatest challenges. 

Check out the rest of our videos here: http://cs.is/2dolqpj

Follow CSIS on Twitter: http://twitter.com/csis

On Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/CSIS.org

And on Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/csis/
transcription:
(dramatic music) - China is asserting claims to
all the waters and air space of the South China Sea. And they're doing it not
primarily with military or law enforcement vessels, they're doing it with an armed militia that camouflages itself by
operating on fishing boats. The maritime militia is really the tip of the spear for China's power projection in the South China Sea. The South China Sea is
the most contested piece of geography on the planet. The largest recent deployment
we've seen of this militia has taken place over the last seven months around Thitu Island which is occupied by about 100 Filipino civilians and a small military contingent. China has had dozens
of these militia boats surrounding the island every day. On a shot from December 20th, what you see is 95 Chinese boats. The heaviest day that we have
monitored around this feature. Every one of them are large. None of them broadcasting the
signals that they should be to avoid collisions. None of them with nets or
other gear in the water. None of them fishing. They just sit there for long
periods of time monitoring and intimidating the Filipinos. It seems clear that China's
goal in the South China Sea is to establish effective
dominance of all the waters and air space within what
they call the 9-Dash Line. They don't want to do that by
fighting a military conflict with the United States or anybody else. What they want to do
is use civilian actors, these paramilitary forces to
effectively control the space. Make it impossible for
their neighbors to operate, and therefore win without
ever having to fight. The U.S. needs to turn away from strictly military responses. The U.S. Navy has a role in
deterring outward aggression and backing up our partners. But the U.S. Navy cannot secure fishing rights for Filipinos. They can't secure law enforcement rights for their neighbors. The only thing that can
do that is a diplomatic and maybe economic effort
in trying to convince China to modify its claims and
especially its behavior to take these paramilitary
forces off the board before there's a crisis.

transcription: the Ching dynasty which was ethnically Manchurian not Han took over China in the 17th century and faced continuous opposition notably from secret societies like the chant a way and the White Lotus but during the 19th century anti-qing sentiment grew thanks to plagues famines floods rebellions and unsuccessful Wars against foreign powers the Jing proved to be pure responding to these disasters had accumulated a lot of debt still had an antiquated army and struggled to govern over a rapidly increasing population so there are numerous rebellions like the Tai ping the Dungan and the yang and although these were unsuccessful they were incredibly costly and many different groups to the post the Qing for various reasons some wanted to give rights to women many more advocated for democracy or at least a constitutional monarchy and there were powerful radical groups like Anika's two had support from fellow anarchists in Japan and elsewhere plus an 1894 during the sino-japanese war a Christian who had studied in Hawaii Sun yat-sen created the revived China Society with the aim of expelling the Manchurian Qing from China from Hong Kong he tried to start the revolution in Guangzhou in 1895 but the plant were discovered and most of the leaves were arrested but anti-qing sentiment continued to grow when empress dowager Sisi launched a coup against the Guangxu Emperor because he tried to modernize China during the hundred days reform in 1898 but despite the ongoing Boxer Rebellion in 1900 Sun yat-sen - a Joe uprising once again failed so in 1905 in exile and Tokyo Sun yat-sen United many anti-qing groups under the leadership of his new secret society the Tong men way from America Malaysian Japan the leaders gathered many supporters many of which were officers and soldiers in China's new army who wanted to modernize China and prevent further foreign incursions but they also had the backing of local gentry who felt disenfranchised by the Ching political system and the new group of intellectuals who had studied abroad all benefit from the new domestic education system but their first attempt to start a revolution in 1910 in Guangzhou failed once again meanwhile many railway lines were being built in China largely by foreign companies the Ching started to allow local governments to build their own lines however they soon gave the right to build these lines back to foreign companies in order to make money and decrease building time this led to large-scale protests in Sichuan in august 1911 led by the railway protection mu many soldiers from nearby Wuhan were sent to help quell the protests but the revolutionaries were unprepared to take advantage of their situation however while making bombs one went off and the police investigating the explosion found a list of all the revolutionaries in the area many of which were in the army so the soldiers of the new army that had remained in Wuhan mutinied seized the government building and created the Huub a military government in early October 1911 telegrams were then dispatched to fellow revolutionaries across the country who simultaneously rose up in just a couple of months tongue men way and their allies took over cities like Shanghai Guangzhou Taiwan coming Nanjing Changsha and Chien and they also took over a lot of provinces like Wang ji and wave Fujian Guangdong Shang Gong Ning Xia chuan angry Joe many which declared their independence and the Chinese did lose out mongolia when the bog took on with the help of the russians declared mongolian independence and 13th Dalai newly created post of Prime Minister largely governed the country he initially tried to crush the rebellions with force and had some success for instance Yuan Shikai and his Bey young army would want to defeat the rebels in Wuhan and ma Ann Liang prevented the rebels from takin CGM but Prince Jing stepped down in early November and yuan shikai became the new prime minister shortly afterwards however Nanjing fell to the rebels in early December and Sun yat-sen was made president of the new provisional Republic of China but Sonia tends to lack the military force needed to challenge Ranchi Kai's BAE young army and was fearful that a prolonged Civil War would encourage further foreign encroachment so in early 1912 with the help of foreign powers the two sides ended peace negotiations Sun yat-sen agreed to hand over control of southern China to Yuan Shikai but you an had to force Pune to abdicate and set up a republic a parliament was created but sun yat-sen's knew Kuomintang party was so successful that yuan began ignoring Parliament in persecuting opposition so a second revolution was launched against you and but this failed and in 1915 you undeclared himself the new emperor but died the following year and just before he died in 1916 military leaders in the south rebelled against him and China began to split up into small states governed by warlords soon yet Sen would eventually to China in the 1920s and trade United but this began the civil war which lasted until the 1940s

title: At least 2 dead, 53 still missing after open-pit coal mine collapse in northern China
description:
Subscribe to our YouTube channel for free here: 
https://sc.mp/subscribe-youtube

At least two people were confirmed dead and more than 50 still missing the morning after an open-pit coal mine collapsed in northern China on February 22, 2023. Around 300 rescuers  had arrived and more were on their way to the site in Alxa Left Banner, an administrative division in the southwestern part of China’s Inner Mongolia autonomous region. Chinese President Xi Jinping and Premier Li Keqiang have ordered an investigation into the accident. Mine safety has long been a headache for China, with a significant number of deadly accidents recorded at mining operations around the country.

title: “An opportunity for American economy…”US State Department heralds mega Air India Boeing deal
description:
United States State Department Spokesperson on Feb 16 said that mega deal between air India and Boeing is an opportunity for American Economy. 
Addressing a Press Conference, Ned Price said, “It is something that we’ve heralded. It is an opportunity not only for the American economy & for workers here in this country, but it’s an opportunity for the Indian people as well.” “It’s an opportunity to deepen what is already a profoundly intertwined relationship based on shared interests, based on shared values, based on our deep economic ties & with the announcements between Boeing & Air India yesterday, those ties are all the deeper,” he added.

description:

Finally, it's a better day to drive I5 in North Portland. After the big storm. It is much improved but to show there is still danger out there. Watch this car, lose it on I-84 this morning near exit 2. Snow and ice and crash. We're making real progress on the roads. We O dots, Don Hamilton says. Despite problem spots, it is much better and like a prize fighter, Oregon is making a comeback. When it was chaos and gridlock. But a lot of people who drive both Oregon and Washington tell us it's often better up in the Evergreen state, especially along I-5. He just thinks there's more challenges in Oregon over Washington. Washed out, does well. I think O dot does well in a much more complicated system. Hamilton agrees with that and explains it. Further, Clark County is mostly flat and straight in Portland and the Portland area. Hamilton also says the Portland side has a lot of commercial truck traffic with lots of truck drivers not chaining up, causing huge backups like this. 825 are plowed clear and open. We also checked in with wash dot. The spokesperson says their snow load was less this time around and there are other factors. Well, I think we just had it a little bit easier. Snow levels were different. Elevation levels are different. Geography is different. So Washington, Oregon is really an apples to oranges comparison. The difference is dramatic. You hit Washington and the roads are more maintained. Sarah Tyree isn't convinced. She says her Interstate commute from Beaverton. Washington state on Wednesday was a complete nightmare. What? transcription: in this video we will learn how a bay is formed a bay is a broad inlet of the sea where the land curves inward a bay can also be called as a gulf but the only noticeable difference you will find is that a bay is semi-circular in shape whereas a gulf is a deep inlet for example have a look at the bay of bengal and the gulf of cumberth if you look at the landmass around the bay of bengal it is in semicircular shape on the other hand if you look at the gulf of khambhat the sea or ocean water goes deep inside the landmass that means a gulf has a deep inlet of the sea or ocean a bay is formed in many ways one of it is plate tectonics the process of continents drifting together and drifting apart causes the formation of many large bays look at bayer bengal the largest bay in the world it was formed by plate tectonics millions of years ago the indian subcontinent crashed and it still continues to crash into the massive aeration plate near the bayou bengal region the indian plate is subducting beneath the small burma plate plate tectonics remain an active force in the bayou bengal today this region is home to underwater earthquakes and tsunamis the formation of san francisco bay is another example of plate tectonic san francisco bay is located on the san andreas fault which is the sliding boundary between the pacific ocean plate and the north american plate bays are also formed when the ocean overflows a coastline kowloon bay in hong kong was formed as the south china sea overflowed the coastline of kowloon peninsula bays are also formed due to erosion many times the ocean erodes the soft rock and sand that forms an entire coastline which eventually curves the coastline inward forming a bay guanabara bay for example was formed as the atlantic ocean eroded an inlet in south america i want you to recollect fjords if you remember they are formed by slow movement of glaciers a glacier slices through the bedrock of an area leaving a long steep canyon which gets filled up with sea water so if the shape of a field is such that the land looks like a semicircular shape only then we can call that fjord as a bay

title: La Marseillaise, sung by Mireille Mathieu. American English subtitles.
description:
Performance at the foot of the Eiffel Tower in 1989 for its 100th anniversary. Mireille Mathieu sings La Marseillaise, the French national anthem. According to reports at the time, "Mathieu sang the anthem of France so grandly and shrewdly that tears welled up across the country, many patriotic citizens even needed medical treatment." Ten years later, she was awarded the Medal of the French Legion of Honor.

My translation to American English, weighing literal accuracy, lyrical style, and contemporary US context.

title: Battotai - Japan Ground Self Defense Force
description:
Battotai can also called the Review March in the Self Defense Force.

Under the terms of the Treaty of Mutual Cooperation and Security between the United States and Japan, United States forces stationed in Japan were to deal with external aggression against Japan while Japanese forces, both ground and maritime, would deal with internal threats and natural disasters. Only after the outbreak of the Korean War did MacArthur authorise Prime Minister Shigeru Yoshida to establish a 75,000 strong National Police Reserve. The next expansion came in 1952, when as a compromise in the face of U.S. calls to build up an army of 350,000, the National Police Reserve was re-titled the National Safety Force and expanded to 110,000.

In 1954, Prime Minister Yoshida impelled the Diet to accept the Defence Agency Establishment and the Self-Defence Force Laws, which explicitly authorized the forces to ‘defend Japan against direct and indirect aggression, and when necessary to maintain public order.’[5] On July 1, 1954, the National Security Board was reorganized as the Defense Agency, and the National Security Force was reorganized afterwards as the Japan Ground Self-Defense Force (Army), the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force (Navy) and the Japan Air Self-Defense Force (Air Force), with General Keizō Hayashi appointed as the first Chairman of Joint Staff Council—professional head of the three branches. The enabling legislation for this was the 1954 Self-Defense Forces Act [Act No. 165 of 1954].

That year the actual strength of the Ground, Maritime and Air Self-Defence Forces reached 146,285, armed mainly with U.S. World War II vintage equipment.[6] At least up until the 1970s, the Ground SDF was not built up to the point required to defeat an invasion attempt from the north – informed officials estimated that while ammunition provisions were officially said to be enough to last for two months, in actuality it would be used up in a week or less.

title: Restoration of the Battleship Texas in dry dock. 4K drone view.
description: Restoration of the Battleship Texas in dry dock. The flyover shows the progress made as of December 2022. You can see the removed portions of the blister tanks, removed guns, decks, as well as the general progress of the project.
transcription:
It is December 2022 and we're at Galveston,
Texas. Here is a bird's-eye view of the historic
Battleship Texas in the dry dock below. The massive ship, which saw action in both
World War I and II, is undergoing a comprehensive restoration project to preserve its legacy
for future generations. The restoration of the Battleship Texas has
been a multi-year effort to preserve this iconic piece of American history for future
generations. The ship, which was commissioned in 1914,
has undergone various renovations over the years to maintain its structural integrity,
but this latest restoration project is the most comprehensive yet. We can see the ship's hull and decks being
repaired and upgraded as workers attend to various systems on board. One of the most important aspects of this
restoration project is the work being done to address the hull corrosion. The Battleship Texas has been in service for
nearly a century, and over time the ship's blister tanks, which were designed to protect
the ship's hull from damage, have begun to rust. This has led to significant leaks, with the
ship leak rate of over 2,000 gallons of water per minute at one point. The restoration team reduced the leak rate
to under 20 gallons per minute before it was towed to the dry deck. They have installed over 750,000 gallons of
expanded foam in the blister tanks, making the Battleship Texas significantly safer to
tow. As we continue to fly over, I am struck by
the dedication and hard work of the restoration team. They are preserving an important piece of
American history and ensuring that the Battleship Texas remains a valuable educational resource
and tourist attraction for years to come. You can see the torpedo blisters were removed
from a specific point down and will be replaced with a slightly modified design, which will
address some of the issues that have been plaguing them since 1948. The workers have been gauging the hull plating
on the aft section of the ship. The thickness of each section is then marked
and recorded, to assess how best to safely replace or repair these areas. The guns on board the Battleship Texas, were
removed as part of the restoration process. The removal of the guns was necessary for
several reasons. First, the guns were heavy and their weight
was affecting the ship's structural integrity. Second, the guns were in poor condition and
had become a safety hazard. Third, the guns required significant maintenance
and repair, which was taking resources away from other areas of the ship that needed attention. The removal of the guns was a complex and
challenging process. The guns weighed several tons each and had
to be carefully disassembled and removed to minimize the risk of damage to the ship. The restoration team worked closely with specialized
contractors to remove the guns and transport them to a secure storage facility. The restoration of the Battleship Texas is
being made possible through the support of private donors, local businesses, and the
state of Texas, who recognize the importance of preserving this iconic ship. When finished, visitors will be able to experience
the ship in a new light, as it will be open for tours and educational programs.

title: Business English Speakers Can Still Be Divided by a Common Language
description:
I'm Alex Villarreal with the VOA Special English Economics Report, from http://voaspecialenglish.com | http://facebook.com/voalearningenglish

Business is the most popular subject for international students in the United States. At last count, twenty-one percent of foreign students at American colleges and universities were studying business and management. The Institute of International Education in New York says engineering is the second most popular field, in case you were wondering.Thomas Cosse is a professor of marketing and business at the University of Richmond in Virginia. He says international students who want to study business need to have good English skills -- and not just to study at his school.But the world has more non-native speakers of English than native speakers. As a result, Americans working with foreign companies may need to learn some new English skills themselves. At the University of Richmond, teams of graduate students work with companies seeking to enter the American market.  The students learn about writing market entry studies. The reports are written in English. But Professor Cosse tells his students to consider who will read them.He said his students have to write the report so that it can be understood by someone who is an English speaker but not a native English speaker. For example, he tells his students to avoid jargon and other specialized terms that people might not know in their own language. This can be good advice even when writing for other native speakers. But effective communication involves more than just words. Kay Westerfield is director of the international business communication program at the University of Oregon. She says you must have the language skills as well as cultural intelligence. Cultural intelligence means the need to consider local behaviors in everything from simple handshakes to speaking to large groups. Still, Kay Westerfield says the ability of foreign workers to speak English is becoming more important to companies looking to move operations to other countries. Or, as she puts it, to "off-source." Also, she says English skills often provide a competitive edge for business students when they seek jobs.  She said: "As one business student in West Africa put it, 'English is a lifeline.'"For VOA Special English I'm Alex Villarreal.  You can read and listen to our programs and find activities for English learners at voaspecialenglish.com. We're also on Facebook and Twitter at VOA Learning English. 

(Adapted from a radio program broadcast 21Jan2011)
transcription: I'm Alex Villarreal with the VOA Special Englis...

title: Why is this millet eatery in Visakhapatnam so popular? | The Hindu
description:
Have you tried millet idlis and dosas? 

In Visakhapatnam, a growing number of people are making the switch from traditional rice batter idlis, to healthier alternatives offered by millets 

This eatery, called Vasenapoli, sees long queues every day, for its special idlis, dosas, jowar roti, millet cakes, and much more 

 The popularity of this hotel soared after the former Vice-President of India M. Venkaiah Naidu visited his stall and tweeted about it in 2021

In fact, the United Nations recently declared 2023 as the International Year of Millets.

What makes Vasenapoli idlis special?

Reporting: Nivedita Ganguly
Production: Shibu Narayan
Videos: V. Raju
Voiceover: Nalme Nachiyar

#millet #millets #visakhapatnam #vizag #vasenapoli

transcription: foreign have you tried Millet idlis and dosas in vishakhapatnam a growing number of people are making the switch from traditional rice batter idlis to healthier Alternatives offered by millets this Eatery called vasanapoli sees long queues every day for its special idlis dosas Joe Roti Millet cakes and much more the popularity of this hotel soared after the former vice president of India M Bankai andaidu visited the stall and tweeted about it in 2021. in fact the United Nations recently declared 2023 as the international year of millets [Music] the idlis are wrapped in vistaraku which are dried leaves stitched together to make plates the idlis are made with ragi Joe bajra Korra UDA arika Sama and Varga the batter is poured into small vistaraku Leaf containers and steamed over fire these conical idlis are served with three types of chutneys ground nut Ginger and a mix of vegetables the dosas and curries are prepared with cold pressed sesame oil the vistaraku leaf gives the idlis a unique flavor it also has antibacterial and antiseptic qualities [Music] the owner chitam sudhir says he gets nine varieties of millets from paderu a tribal belt in vishakhapatnam District and parvatipuram in vizianagaram District where they are organically grown by the tribal farmers [Music] sudhir says he has noticed a greater awareness for shifting to millage based food especially after the pandemic millets are full of antioxidants vitamins minerals and are also high on fiber content regular customers say that switching to a millet diet has helped control diabetes in a big way the last sentence I'm coming here I'm taking regularly so my sugar has been controlled average now it is around 130 140 below 150 is always 100 healthy I am the regular customer of this daily I've been morning and evening I used to come here and have this it is a great financial for all diseases for which so there is a taking care of the health of this city [Music]

strategic partnership that we have with india i think poses the opportunity to do more good in the 21st century and have more more consequence more impact than anything that the ccp could do uh coming now president then senator biden helped shepherd through uh this institution through the trump administration uh as well uh and uh and prior to that the obama administration uh and now uh through ours Today on the show, we have with us the very special Cecilia Oldne. I met Cecilia for the first time 3 years ago at one of the social events we were a part of. Since then, we have exchanged so many conversations, and she has been an absolute mentor of mine when it comes to my investments and startup decisions.

Cecilia moved from Stockholm to Mumbai in 2007 to spark what is today called the Indian Wine Revolution of India’s largest wine company Sula Vineyards. During her time with Sula, she placed India on the world wine map and that's how headed the marketing for it.

In this clip, she shares her experience of living in India for more than 15 years.

transcription: BASED ON A FED PAUSE THAT IS NOT COMING IS HE RIGHT? JOINING US TODAY, CARLYLE  GROUP'S CO-FOUNDER, DAVID  RUBENSTEIN IT'S GREAT TO HAVE YOU THANKS FOR JOINING US TODAY. >> MY PLEASURE FOR BEING HERE. THANK YOU FOR HAVING ME. >> YOU'VE BEEN PRETTY CLEAR, EVEN WHEN THE MARKET SORT OF DOUBTED IT, THAT INFLATION WOULD BE PERSISTENT. DO YOU REGARD THE LAST FEW WEEKS AS THE MARKET COMING DOWN TO WHAT CHAIR POWELL HAS BEEN TRYING TO GET ACROSS FOR MONTHS? >> I THINK THE MARKET IS FINALLY RECOGNIZING THAT INFLATION IS  NOT GOING AWAY THE FED IS RESOLUTE. THEY MADE IT CLEAR SEVERAL TIMES RECENTLY THAT THEY REALLY WANT TO GET THE RATE DOWN TO -- INFLATION RATE DOWN TO 2%, NOT 3% I THINK THE MARKET TAKES THE FED VERY SERIOUSLY BUT THAT DOESN'T MEAN WE'RE  GOING TO HAVE A HARD LANDING OR  SO-CALLED RECESSION. IT'S TOO EARLY FOR ANYBODY TO  REALLY KNOW WHETHER THAT'S GOING TO HAPPEN OR NOT >> DO YOU THINK THE MARKET GOT TOO EXCITED JUST OVER THE LAST,  I DON'T KNOW, FEW WEEKS AND  MONTH ABOUT A FED PAUSE AND A  FED PIVOT? YOU SPOKE TO FED CHAIR POWELL. I DON'T THINK HE SOUNDED PARTICULARLY DOVISH, DO YOU? >> I DON'T WANT TO CHARACTERIZE  IT, BUT I WOULD JUST SAY HE MADE IT CLEAR THAT THEY ARE DETERMINED TO GET THE INFLATIO RATE DOWN. AND I THINK THE EARLIER  EXPECTATION THAT MAYBE THERE WOULD BE RATE CUTS BIT END OF  THE YEAR, I THINK THAT'S OUT THE WINDOW BASED ON WHAT WE NOW SEE  AND WHAT HE NOW SEES CLEARLY THE MARKET COULD CHANGE, THE WORLD COULD CHANGE BASED ON WHAT THE FED SEES NOW,  I'M NOT AUTHORIZED TO SPEAK FOR  THE FED, I DON'T THINK THE FED WILL DECREASE RATES THIS YEAR. THAT TO SOME EXTENT IS BEING REFLECTED IN THE STOCK MARKET. >> WHAT ABOUT THE DEAL ENVIRONMENT, DAVID I ALWAYS LIKE TO ASK YOU WHAT  YOU'RE SEEING IN TERMS OF DEAL FLOW AND, YOU KNOW, REALLY OBVIOUSLY DRIED UP LAST YEAR 2023 LOOK DIFFERENT? >> THE MARKET IS GETTING BETTER. OBVIOUSLY, THERE'S FEWER DEALS BEING DONE THAN PEOPLE IN THE  BUSINESS WORLD WOULD LIKE, OR AT LEAST IN A DEALS WORLD I KNOW THERE'S A NUMBER OF DEALS IN THE WORKS AND THERE IS DEBT AVAILABLE FOR WELL-STRUCTURED  DEALS AT REASONABLE PRICES THERE IS DEBT THERE. NOT JUST FOR THE BANKS BUT FROM  OTHER LENDERS. I DO THINK YOU'LL SEE MORE DEAL  ACTIVITY IN THE NEXT FEW MONTHS. I JUST BELIEVE THAT THE  PRINCIPLE WE'VE HAD RECENTLY IS  PEOPLE WERE EXPECTING A  RECESSION AND, THEREFORE, BUYERS WERE RELUCTANT TO BUY INTO A RECESSION. IT'S NOT CLEAR IF THEY EXPECT A  RECESSION OR NOT, BUT PEOPLE ARE BEGINNING TO LOWER THEIR EXPECTATION, SELLERS ARE GETTING SOMEWHAT LOWER IN WHAT THEY  WANTED TO GET FROM PRICES WHEN THEY SELL. I THINK BUYERS ARE MAYBE STEPPING UP A LITTLE MORE. I THINK WE'LL SEE MORE DEAL  ACTIVITY THE GAP BETWEEN SELLERS AND  BUYERS IS NOT AS GREAT AS IT WAS NINE MONTHS AGO OR SIX MONTHS  AGO. >> TO EXTEND THAT TO, SAY, THE EQUITIES IN THE IPO MARKET, THE  JOURNAL AND OTHERS HAVE DONE STORIES ABOUT BUDDING INTEREST IN, SAY, ONLINE GAMING AND RESTAURANTS AND EVEN SOME AREAS  OF TECH THAT MIGHT EVENTUALLY  FIND A WINDOW TO COME TO MARKET. DO YOU THINK THAT ENDS UP BEING, I DON'T KNOW, A Q2 DIEYNAMIC, A  SECOND HALF DYNAMIC? >> HARD TO SAY YOU HAVE TO RECOGNIZE THERE'S A  FAIR AMOUNT OF GROWTH CAPITAL  OUT THERE RIGHT NOW. THAT MONEY CAN BE USED TO EXTEND THE COMPANY'S STAY AS A PRIVATE  COMPANY. IT USED TO BE THAT AFTER TWO OR  THREE YEARS AS REASONABLY PROFIT COMPANY, YOU WOULD GO PUBLIC NOW YOU CAN GET MORE GROWTH  CAPITAL TO GROW YOUR COMPANY AND THE NEED TO GO PUBLIC ISN'T  QUITE WHAT IT WAS MANY YEARS AGO. I THINK IT MAY TAKE A WHILE  BEFORE YOU SEE PEOPLE COMING TO  THE MARKET AS THE PRICES THEY'RE HAPPY TO GET >> HIGHER FOR LONGER AND PRIVATE FOR LONGER, IN A SENSE.  >> WE HAVE MORE PRIVATELY OWNED  COMPANIES NOW THAN PUBLICLY  TRADED COMPANIES FOR SURE. THAT'S BECAUSE BEING IN A  PRIVATE MARKET HAS SOME APPEAL TO PEOPLE. I DON'T THINK YOU'LL SEE A RUSH  OF IPOs RIGHT AWAY IT WILL TAKE A WHILE >> WHAT ABOUT PRIVATE EQUITY IN  PARTICULAR, BECAUSE WE'RE SEEING MORE PUBLIC COMPANIES GO PRIVATE VIA PRIVATE EQUITY BUYOUTS THAN  ACTUAL PUBLIC IPOs IN YOUR FORECAST THAT YOU JUST GAVE, YOU EXPECT MORE DEALS THIS YEAR DOES THAT INCLUDE FROM PRIVATE EQUITY >> YES.  >> HOW MUCH OF A DRIVER? >> WHEN I TALK ABOUT DEALS, I'M  TALKING ABOUT VENTURE CAPITAL, GROWTH CAPITAL AND OTHER KINDS OF THINGS. IN TERMS OF COMPANIES GOING  PRIVATE, THERE'S A LOT OF APPEAL TO BEING A PRIVATELY OWNED COMPANY, FOR SURE. A LOT OF LESS REGULATION AND OVERSIGHT, SO FORTH. A LOT OF CEOs, A LOT OF BOARDS ARE SAYING, WELL, MAYBE WE WOULD BE BETTER OFF TO BE PRIVATE FOR  A WHILE, FIX SOME PROBLEMS WE  HAVE OUTSIDE OF THE VIEWERSHIP OF ALL PUBLIC TRADER

transcription: is it an island no it's a sea vessel 30 minutes away by boat this giant silhouette is visible from the shore this is the USS Ronald Reagan hopping in Manila for the first time after patrolling unhindered in the disputed South China Sea the US Navy opens its doors to the media and gives a brief tour of its hangar the USS Ronald Reagan is a nimitz-class aircraft carrier with 5,000 officers and crew on board it's a sea vessel but it feels like a fortress the ship is equipped with missiles guns and the latest in electronic warfare commander Rear Admiral mark Dalton says the USS Ronald Reagan is in the Philippines for a quick R&R so the primary purpose of our port visit is to give ourselves a chance to experience everything that dalton says many of the USS Reagan's Navy men are connected to the country in fact over a hundred of its crew and officers are Filipino Americans one of them is Earl Bob Leo who spent his childhood in the Philippines and is now one of the vessel chefs five years ago I feel I feel very excited looking forward to the food again and the parks and all the stuff MOA of course go shopping and meet all kinds people Publio says he has been in the US Navy for over a year and a half joining patrols off Korea Hong Kong and Singapore we are here at the hanger of the USS Ronald Reagan named after President Ronald Reagan of the United States behind me are the crew they are off for what they call Liberty where they go to the country and they go around and have fun and as their commanders set it to get their time off and here at the hangar to are the fighter jets that they deploy when it comes to patrols and also in times of conflict peace through strength this is the model of the USS Reagan and the underlying reason for its visit before Manila Dalton says the USS regan went around the disputed South China Sea as part of annual patrols in the indo-pacific region Dallben says they patrolled without incident coordinating with all countries as they roamed the waters this continued presence in the indo-pacific has supported our ability to defend our nation and our allies but it also promotes our ability to safeguard freedom of the seas unimpeded commerce to deter conflict and coercion and to promote adherence to rules based international water satellite images show China has built over 1600 structures in the disputed waters with 800 of these located in the part of the sea that belongs to the Philippines the USS Ronald Reagan is the third aircraft carrier to visit the Philippines in 2018 in the middle of rising tension in the region it is a clear display of power by the United States while its longtime Ally the Philippines becomes friendlier with Beijing by the day with the growing aggressiveness of China in the contested waters can the United States maintain the strength based peace treasures in the region Rambo Taliban grappler Manila

WAGES ARE STILL STRONG EVEN THOUGH THEY'RE COMING DOWN  A LITTLE BIT, STILL STRONG SO REAL INCOMES ARE ARE ACTUALLY GOING UP FOR THE CONSUMER, AND I WOULD JUST SIMPLY POINT OUT THAT THE CONSUMER IS NOT ALL GLOOM  AND DOOM I WENT BACK AND I LOOKED AT  WALMART, KROGER, AND DOLLAR  GENERAL ON A THREE-YEAR STACK  BASIS FOR COMPS. THAT IS AN INDICATION OF DEMAND. AND WALMART SAW 24% INCREASE ON  THREE-YEAR STACK BASIS TO COMPS, KROGER AT 22%, AND DOLLAR  GENERAL UP 17% THIS IS JUST AN INDICATION OF  WHAT COMPANIES ARE TELLING US  THAT THEY'RE SEEING AND SO THE CONSUMER REMAINS STRONG, RESILIENT IS THE WORD I WOULD  USE AND THEN ALSO I WOULD LOOK AT THE ISM SERVICES AND  COMPOSITE NUMBERS, CHICAGO FEDERAL NATIONAL ACTIVITY INDEX  CAME OUT THE FIRST POSITIVE NUMBER THAT CAME OUT IN FOUR MONTHS. SO THERE IS UNDERLYING MOMENTUM, AND, YEAH, THIS IS ALSO LEADING  TO STUBBORN STICKY INFLATION AND IT IS NOT GOING TO CHANGE THE  FED'S PATH, BUT I KIND OF THINK  THE ECONOMY IS SO MUCH MORE  MOMENTUM THAN IT IS GETTING  CREDIT FOR AND I THINK THAT'S  GOING TO TRANSLATE INTO BETTER EARNINGS, NOT GREAT EARNINGS,  SCOTT. YOU KNOW THAT, BUT NOT A COLLAPSE BY ANY MEANS BECAUSE I  DO THINK OVERALL EVERYONE IS TALKING ABOUT THE EXPENSIVE  MARKET, BUT I THINK THE E IS WRONG. I THINK THE E IS GOING TO BE BETTER THAN PEOPLE SUGGEST.  >> IN OTHER WORDS, YOU'RE TOO  NEGATIVE YOU'RE NOT FOCUSING ON ANY OF  THE POSITIVE, YOU JUST ASSUME  THE FED HAS DONE A LOT AND IT IS ULTIMATELY GOING TO HAVE A TOLL  ON THE ECONOMY, AND THE CONSUMER WHO IS GOING TO RUN OUT OF MONEY, AND DELINQUENCIES WILL  PICK UP EVEN MORE THAN THEY  ALREADY HAVE ON CREDIT CARDS AND THIS WHOLE THING IS GOING TO COME EVENTUALLY TO AN END. >> SO WHAT'S GREAT ABOUT OUR VIEW IS THAT EVEN IF EARNINGS  DON'T GO DOWN AT ALL, THE MARKET IS STILL OVERVALUED AT THIS  PRICE, IF WE HAVE THIS GREAT PERFECT LANDING, PERFECT LANDING, GROWTH, INFLATION COMES DOWN, FED STOPS HIKING, STOCKS ARE STILL TOO EXPENSIVE, AND WILL LIKELY MOVE LOWER, NOW, HERE'S WHAT I WOULD TELL YOU AROUND EARNINGS. ON OCTOBER 1st, OKAY, OF LAST  YEAR, THE ESTIMATE FOR THE NEXT  12 MONTHS WAS $235 WE HAVE NOW HAD 2.5% GDP IN THE  FOURTH QUARTER, WE'RE LOOKING  LIKE 2%, 2.5% IN THE FIRST QUARTER AND THE EARNIN

description:

transcription: in the middle of the 17th century the many Mongol groups were largely united ANDed independent states the orap mongols largely formed the jungle Carnot and the calchas Buryats and many others formed the northern Yuan Dynasty however the cha has until the Mongols had been invaded by the church and who would go on to invade China and create the Ching dynasty this land in the south would go on to form what is now Inner Mongolia whereas Outer Mongolia was invaded at the end of the 17th century and the jungles were largely annihilated in the 18th century and Mongolian influence in the region was lost Mongolian land was divided into different regions with their own nobility and were guaranteed some autonomy Han Chinese were initially banned from living in Mongolia but in the 19th century many began to settle in Inner Mongolia illegally but numerous unsuccessful Wars rebellions and famines in the late 19th century in China caused the Ching dynasty to request taxes be paid in silver this crippled the Mongolian economy because they needed to take out loans from Chinese lenders to pay it plus in the early 20th century the Ching dynasty as part of their new policies tried to colonize Mongolia by saddling Han Chinese in the region this was a response to Russian expansion in northern China the russians had settled people in the far east and took old chinese territory north of the Amur around 1860 first they moved troops into Manchuria during the Boxer Rebellion and annexed the Liao Tong Peninsula and in Mongolia they began settling and Tuva in large numbers however Han immigration angered the Mongols so when a qing appointed official was sent to implement the new reforms in 1910 small-scale fighting broke out between the mongols and chinese Kalka nobles began to call for independence with the bog deconned leader of mongolian buddhists as their head of state and even sent a delegation to russia to request aid but just a year later in 1911 Chinese revolutionaries rose up against the Qing Dynasty many of which declared independence for the respective provinces this allowed the Mongolians to declare independence from China without much opposition however the Russian sent troops into Tuva and turned it into a protectorate and any Mongolians ruling over more Han Chinese chose to remain under Chinese rule the new theocratic Mongolian state however lost any potential support from Russia with the outbreak of World War one so the Russian signed the treaty with China which made Mongolia an autonomous region under his rule then in 1917 Mongolia quickly became involved in the Russian Civil War early at mongols living within Russia from the short-lived state of Berea Mongolia and in its capital Cheeta a pan Mongolian conference was held this was initially supported by the Japanese who wanted to create a buffer state in between them and the Bolsheviks and led by the likes for the White Army General Grigory seminoff the pan Mongols hoped to create a state that would unite the buryat state outer in Inner Mongolia sing Jan and even Tibet but this pan Mongol state may have removed the bog to confirm power so the nobility appealed to the Chinese for help in 1919 power in China at that time had been divided between competing warlords but duan Curie and his aunt Wakely controlled beijing and after taking out loans from japan he was very much under their influence plus by late 1919 the Bolsheviks were rapidly pushing East in Russia and the Japanese were worried about them moving into Mongolia so they somewhat pressured one into offering help to the bog diccon and 14,000 troops quickly occupied Mongolia ending its autonomy however this was opposed by many and some like dustman Buddha choy Paulson and sukhbaatar from the Communist Mongolian People's Party but in Russia in late 1920 in monarchists and white army general roman van egmond Sternberg formed an army of Buryats Tartars and other ethnicities and invaded mongolia the chinese man should fight back his first invasion but he invaded again in February 1921 forced the Chinese out of her modern-day ulaanbataar and restored the bog to come to power this however got the Bolsheviks to send weapons to the Mongolian People's Party and sukhbaatar led an army of a few hundred guerrillas a Red Army expeditionary force was sent to the border in crush Holland Sternberg's counter-attack and entered a ger in July 19-21 although the Soviets formed the Tuvans People's Republic in the north they didn't install a communist leader in Mongolia because they still hope to repair their relations with China instead the bog Diccon ruled as a constitutional Manik but who was made Prime Minister but his policy of forcibly curtain off feudal objects like jewelry forced him to resign and soup Rita died in 1923 however in 1924 the bhakti Kahn died and the Mongolians People's Party declared no reincarnation to will be accepted and took power the Mongolians People's Republic was declared fully independent but over time especially under Stalin Soviets began to assert more authority in the region under the 1930s Charlie parson who has been dubbed the Mongolian Stalin took power and began to implement Stalinist policies and even purge thousands of people so it became a sort of Soviet puppet state but the Chinese still claimed Mongolia for decades [Music]

title: TV 2 |All that we share
description:
We live in a time when we are quick to put each other in booths.But maybe we really have more in common than we think?It is a pleasure to introduce everything we share.

English version: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jd8TJHVO1TC
transcription:
Labeling people just takes a single look. There's us. And there's them. Those with high incomes. And those without. Those we trust. And those we avoid. The new Danes. And those who have always been here. Those from the countryside. And those who have never seen a cow. The religious. And the confident. There are those
we share something with. And those we don't share something with. Welcome. I have some questions
for you all today. Some may be a bit personal - - but I hope
you'll answer them truthfully. Which of you was the class clown? Who are stepparents? And then there's suddenly us. We who believe in life after death. We who have seen a UFO. And all of us who love to dance. Some of us have been bullied. And some of us have bullied others. And then there's us who are lucky
enough to have had sex in the last week. Those of us with a broken heart. Those of us who are madly in love. Those of us who are lonely. Those of us who are bisexual. And those of us who acknowledge
the courage of others. Those of us who have found the meaning of life. And those of us who have saved a life. And then there's all of us
who just love Denmark. So maybe we have more in common
than we think. TV 2
All that we share

title: Warlord Era | 3 Minute History
description:
Becaue My Pronunciation is Terrible Here is a Lot of the People Mentioned:

KMT Leaders -Sun Yat Sen, Song Jiaoren (Assassinated), Wang jingwei, Chen Jiongming (Betrayed Sun)

Kmt allies -tang jiyao, li zongren, Lu Rongting (FOUGHT Guangdong -Guangxi War)

Anhui Clique Leader -Duan Qirui

Fengtian clique leader -zhang zhoulin

Zhili clique leaders -feng guozhang, cao kun, sunfang and wu peifu

Ma clique

XINJIANG Leader -yang Zengxin

Shaanxi leader -yan xishan

Sichuan Leaders -MANY

Christian Warlord -Feng yuxiang
transcription: In 1911 the Xinhai revolution saw China became a Republic under Yuan Shikai, a General within the powerful Beiyang Army. However China lost both Mongolia and Tibet and thousands of Bai Lang bandits pillaged the countryside. And, as the Qing dynasty fell apart Generals and even bandit leaders seized provincial and asserted their autonomy. And these became the warlords. Sun Yat-Sens Kuomintang, the party who largely led the revolution, made many concessions in the establishment of the Republic. But the KMT leader in the new Assembly, Song Jiaoren, still won the elections in 1913 after campaigning to reduce to the powers of the Presidency. He was however was assassinated shortly afterwards, causing many in KMT strongholds in the South to rise up against Yuan. This, the second revolution, however was quickly and the KMT was banned. Yuan, now looking for international support, took out foreign loans, and agreed to give Japan more concessions as part of the 21 demands. All of which angered his nationalistic Generals. Then, in 1915, he crowned himself Emperor, encouraging a Clique of Generals in Yunnan to declare independence, starting the National Protection War in December. Yuans armies were defeated and Generals across Southern China joined the uprising, so he agreed to restore the Republic just before dying. Li Yuanhong was made the new President, but, he fell out with his Prime Minister, Duan Qirui, over China’s entry into WW1. And as Beijing became divided, one General, Zhang Xun, marched into Beijing with the deposed Puyi Emperor in July 1917, hoping to restore the Monarchy. Zhangs armies were defeated but Li still resigned, allowing Duan to rule alongside Li’s Vice President, Feng Guozhang. However Sun Yat-Sen arrived back in the South and, alongside Southern Warlords who had previously opposed Yuan Shikai, like Tang Jiyao, established a rival government, starting the Constitutional Protection movement. Duan favoured crushing the KMT militarily, but Feng favoured diplomacy. So the 2 split and, now fearful of one another, formed cliques with allied officers and bureaucrats. Feng formed the Zhili Clique and Duan the Anhui Clique, which was backed by Japan. But many Generals remained neutral, like Zhang Zhoulin’s Fengtian Clique in Manchuria, and there was the Muslim Ma Clique, Yang Zengxin in Xinjiang, Yan Xishan in Shanxi and many minor ones in provinces like Sichuan, which was being fought over by numerous warlords. The new President in Beijing, Xu Shichang, remained neutral and but had very little power. But in 1918 many turned against Duan when his expeditions South proved a failure. And he recognised Japans acquisition of German concessions and used Japanese loans to reoccupy Mongolia. The subsequent anti-Japanese May the 4th Movement, saw thousands protest and helped create the Chinese Communist Party. So, taking advantage of this, Cao Kun, the new leader of the Zhili Clique, forged an alliance with Zhang’s Fengtian Clique and attacked. In July 1920, after the 9 day long Anhui-Zhili war, the allies took Beijing and divided power in the City. The Anhui survived, because no faction had the military capacity or will to fight a prolonged war. So boundaries kept changing, but because the rulers of Beijing got international recognition, this was the main target. Meanwhile, in the South Sun Yat-Sen fell out with his old ally, Lu Rongting, over his peace talks with the Zhili Clique. So Sun raised and army and, during the subsequent Guangdong-Guangxi war, forced Lu out of Guangzhou and temporarily occupied Guangxi in mid-1921. And, in Beijing, the Fengtian and Zhili Cliques, fell out with one another when the politicians installed by Zhang were removed from parliament. So, Zhang, now with Japanese support, tried to take Beijing in April 1922, but failed and Caos Zhili Clique achieved complete control of the capital. Cao tried, but failed to make peace with Sun Yat-Sen. So he encouraged one of Sun’s Generals, Chen Jiongming, to switch sides and chase Sun out of China. Chen however was toppled by Tang Jiyao a year later, keeping the South under KMT control. The KMT, who had been receiving aid from Japanese groups, then began receiving aid from the Soviet Union and formed the First United Front alongside the small Communist Party of China. Cao meanwhile, had support from the West and made a new Constitution, but, in 1924, Zhang attacked again. Zhang's now well-funded armies overwhelmed the Zhili, but before he could take Beijing, one of Cao’s Generals, Feng Yuxian, seized power in a coup. Feng ended the war and agreed to make Duan President again. Plus, as a Christian and socialist, he was sympathetic to the KMT, but Sun Yat-Sen died before any unification agreements could be made. Then in November 1925 Feng persuaded a Manchurian General to switch allegiances, so Zhang responded by invading again. The Zhili Clique had divided by this point between Sun Chuanfang and Wu Peifu. But Wu agreed to help Zhang take Beijing in early 1926 and drove Feng West. But the warlords wars had damaged the economy and many sold opium and raised taxes to fund their wars and lavish lifestyles. So many joined the Communists and KMT and the KMT found found a new ally, Li Zongren in Guangxi. But, since Sun Yat-Sen's death the KMT was divided and it were only able to go on the offensive after Chiang Kai Shek took power in a coup.

title: Winter storm knocks out power for nearly one million people in Midwest
description:
A devastating winter storm is sweeping across the U.S., knocking out power to nearly a million people in the Midwest and causing car crashes in California. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez has the latest on the nationwide weather whiplash.

title: 'Mass Destruction' Litters The Landscape In Rolling Fork, Mississippi
description:
FOX Weather's Robert Ray provides a firsthand look at what he describes as "mass destruction" in Rolling Fork, Mississippi, following Friday night's devastating EF-4 tornado. #foxweather #weather #mississippi #tornado 

Subscribe to FOX Weather!
Watch more FOX Weather videos: https://www.foxweather.com/video
We’ve got you covered! Whether you’re planning your morning commute or keeping a close eye on a severe storm, no one keeps you prepared like FOX Weather - the perfect resource to keep you safe and secure from whatever Mother Nature throws your way. FOX Weather, Weathering It Together!
Here's how you can stay safe with the FOX Weather app:
·        Get alerts for dangerous weather in your area
·        Stream our 24/7 live coverage with our hurricane experts
·        Track storms in your area with the 3D mobile radar
Download for free on iOS and Android devices: bit.ly/3SF7Mhl
Want to watch us on TV? You can find us on The Roku Channel, Fire TV, and YouTube TV or your favorite streaming device.
transcription: it is about 6 30 p.m central time on Saturday evening this is Rolling Fork Mississippi and this is less than 24 hours since this massive tornado came in and I just want to give you all a first perspective as to what I am seeing here on the ground as I get out sun is about to go down here and really in multiple directions I'm seeing mass destruction uh this is uh bad stuff as I turn the camera you can see look at this vehicle here the entire top smashed down by the force of this event and look at that all smashed in perhaps you can hear the sounds of that horn in the distance as I turn the camera again and walk into all of this debris right now and the sides of this home completely collapse you see a drone above me uh clearly either a first responder drone or media that is flying right now as I will continue to walk through this debris field and show you this tree you could see splintered people's clothes are literally hanging from this tree someone's jeans right up there a fence with people's belongings on the sides and I will try to be very careful and walk through some of this not to step on you know people's keepsakes there may be picture albums and other items here that people want as you can see right now this is the inside of someone's home it appears this is a dryer or a washer someone's hot water tank right there and you see all of this home just crushed and mangled by this storm you walk a little bit more in the distance you see the First Responders with the roadblocks the foundation of someone's home right here used to be a home obviously as the sun is coming down take a look at this this is someone's a student's it looks like a Trapper Keeper from school first period 8 30 to 9 42. we'll put that down gently and hopefully everyone here was okay but look at the debris from insulation on this tree that is falling another tree and look at that a woman's dress dangling from the top of that tree a toilet on the ground and I have to be careful look at this I just stepped on this here splintered wood with large Nails coming out oh this is uh this is a very bad tornado that came through here tracked about 100 miles and a half wide this is a very bad scene National Weather Service one person from the National Weather Service saying that this is one of the worst that they have seen as far as assessment on the ground I have been in the Joplin tornado of 2011 the Tuscaloosa tornado of 2011. and you know your first instincts when you come upon this is you unfortunately you do you you try to compare to others and Mayfield a year and a half ago not good look at this guys all of these cars just smashed in together you see the electrical wires laying in the standing water in the distance this was a neighborhood and this is a road here that you know kids played on families walked Saturday evening right now beautiful out would have been a wonderful evening if not for this event another vehicle fully smashed so this assessment will continue the cleanup you can you could hear already there are many casualties and injuries and uh as the sun goes down here on Saturday evening here not far from the Mississippi River people are Mourning and they're assessing and they're trying to do their best to step forward and I leave you with this progress already in the aftermath of this horrific and deadly tornado I'm Amy Freeze welcome to Fox weather's YouTube page we have more great videos on the way so make sure to subscribe to stay updated on all things weather

title: Farmer finds old Bitcoins and buys Mercedes SUV
description:
Henrik Koch from Helsinge experienced it all dreaming of: He spent 100 kroner in 2011. Shortly before Christmas, his investment had risen to more than a million.

Back then, Bitcoins were a new phenomenon.But could make them even - it's called "my" Bitcoins.This was done by connecting your computer to a large system where a lot of computers jointly calculated complicated maths.

- When I had a nice gaming computer at home, I started a graphics card with that task, he tells TV 2 Lorry.

He mined a total of 12 bitcoins - it cost him about 100 kroner in power.Somewhat the same as they were worth, but they were impossible to use in Denmark.

- So I just shrugged my shoulders and said it's a lot of fun to have, I leave them lying.

When Henrik came to mind about his "mining project" the value of a single bitcoins had increased from 10 kroner to almost 130,000.But unfortunately the computer was long since scrapped.

- But as the farmer I am, I never throw out anything.So the old disks from the scrapped computer were just behind, says Henrik Koch, pointing into the closet where his current computer is.
