title: TV 2 |All that we share 2
description:
We have a lot in common.It's just not always that we discover it.

TV 2 - all that we share

English Version: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qakfyobkiyq&t=1s
transcription:
The people sitting here have a lot to talk about. They just don’t know it … yet. In a minute, we’ll show them that they have more in common than they think. Hello, everybody. Thank you for coming. Thomas,
will you stand there, please? And Aske. Thomas, you and your family
live in a lovely house - - at Vinkelhøj 8 in Viby. Before you moved there,
it was your childhood home, Aske. That's correct. Soccer in the garden. I can imagine.
We do it all the time. - Mathilde, please come forward.
- Hi. The two of you
have been facing each other before. But you were 12 years old.
And it was in a rugby match. And by the way,
Aske's team beat your team by 42-0. Thanks for a good match. Inger. Mathilde, the night you were born
27 years ago at Christiania, - - Inger was the first ever human
you saw. You were my midwife? Yes. - It was so fine.
- You remember? Anna, in 2012,
your husband is out jogging. Suddenly, he collapses
and has a heart attack. Luckily, someone reacts promptly
and saves him. Knud, please come forward. Thanks. So good to meet you. Just below the surface, a total stranger can turn out to be someone you’re actually connected to. It's been a while. Someone who rouses forgotten memories. Really? Like the very first kiss. Someone who reminds you that you're not alone. But that somebody else also has
a bulldog named Preben. Someone like the firefighter Thomas who put out a fire at Vibeke's place. We're so thankful
that the fire brigade came right away. Someone you’ve been gaming with for years, but … - Do you know each other? … have never met. - No. - 'Altamon' meet 'Lil Salt'. - No way! You're the topfragger! We've known each other for
three-four years without ever meeting. If we approach each other, we might find out that we share the same destiny. Rana and Maher, you came to Denmark
from Syria four years ago. Dorrit and Jan, you have
a similar story from World War II. I tried living as a refugee. And I will never forget it. It has meant everything. And Rikke. It was your great-grandfather
who risked his life - - by sailing Jan to Sweden
that night in October 1943. It’s easy to mind your own business. It takes a little more effort to mind the community. But doesn’t the feeling of having something in common, - - something that connects us, make it all worthwhile? TV 2 – All that we share

title: APEC Economic Leaders’ Meeting (AELM) Family Photo 11/11/2017
description:

November 11, 2017

title: U.S. Marines Learn Jungle Survival Training from Philippine Marines
description:
U.S. Marines from the 3D Law Enforcement Battalion receive a class on jungle survival techniques from Philippine Marines in support of Balikatan 2013. Video by Karen Nowowieski | Pentagon Channel | Date: 04.11.2013 

=== AiirSource === 
Give us your thumbs up for the troops!
Source for interesting current- and archival military videos.

transcription: I'm out of here once we get lost then there's no way we can find some food so this training would helps you when how we can survive in a jungle leave by your wits oh you have to use your intellect in order to survive from Des Moines and it's so and it's so thing it's very cold but as of now we will teach you first the basic skills surface and it was I'm elevating so you have to conduct a test and an assessment then judge if there's a need to transfer to another area minivan before the dawn oh how it's going on out here today is there the Filipino Marines are teaching us some survival skills such as how to catch water make a shelter catch food and pretty much just how to survive overall in the wilderness if your loss make some holes then if you see some obstructions just use the poker to clear the obstruction then blow most importantly we are giving them some requirements familiar sessions about the medicinal plants that we can see in the jungle or locally known as lagoon D in the Philippines so it's good for cough also that we teach them how to build fire how to cook for the young bamboo stems today they taught me things like how to find true north how do you make fire using bamboo and how to make traps such as a snare trap if there's release and go came up the neck I do think this will have a lasting pack on my career because you take little things about little things and we have some good instructors so it just sticks your head pretty good yes um for us it's not more on training what we should but the camaraderie among the yes ensign in particular because we shared with them what we've got here in the Philippines and as as I give a put back or give back to their government of the United States Armed Forces we are soldiers we are living we are Marines we afraid of nothing you

title: A LAIG ELECTION CAMP - the best moments
description:
The 2019 election campaign is over, and with its 29 days it is the longest in Denmark for 44 years.

It has offered several surprises and memorable moments.From three new eligible parties: Stram Course, New Civil and Klaus Riskær Pedersen, to Lars Løkke Rasmussen's hand over the middle to Mette Frederiksen, to 'Gokke-Jokke', food poisonings and other more or less unpredictable things.

We've cooked the long election campaign down to the very best moments.
_________________________________________________________________

Welcome to DR News YouTube channel.

Here you can watch surprising and enlightening videos about the world we live in.

Feel free to embed/embed our videos on your website.

Remember to talk nicely.The profile here is moderated according to DR's rules for good behavior on DR's social profiles.

You can subscribe to our channel by clicking on DR News logo and you can also click on many of our other news offers.

Facebook:
http://facebook.com/DRNews

Instagram:
https://www.instagram.com/drnyheter/
 
Snapchat:
https://www.snapchat.com/add/dr- News

DR News at Messenger:
https://www.messsemsermsermaer.com/t/drews

Twitter:
http://twitter.com/DRNews (all news)
http://twitter.com/drbreaking (Breaking only)

DR News:
https://www.dr.dk/News

DR TV:
https://www.dr.dk/tv

News app: Send SMS with "App" to 1212 or pick it up in the App Store or Google Play.
transcription:
Now the election is finally decided.  It has
been the longest election campaign in 44 years. It already starts on May 7. - EL has drawn up a climate plan. - I tried on shoes for my wedding. There has been climate hysteria in it. Do not love ... Where are we today? You want to govern with me, don't you? Oops!  It was a lover not day. - I think we are making progress. - Minimum norms. - It's awesome. - It ain't over before the fat lady sings. - No Christianity in the Folketing. - I am available to the doubters. - The best development aid is birth control pills. - Is there an adult present? With 13 parties, there are three more than at the election in 2015. Mette Frederiksen cancels the first party leader debate. - I've got food poisoning. - A substitute is called. - It's a bit like going to an exam without having had a study holiday. - You look so nice. - Three days later she is ready again. title: Building where teen died in elevator skipped fixes to save money, whistleblower says
description: In Aug. 2021, 18-year-old JaMarcus McFarland died in an elevator malfunction at a mixed-use building called 444 Highland in Old Fourth Ward.
transcription: Than 800 elevators are overdue for inspection in Atlanta alone. This was, according to state documents, obtained by 11 alive and investigators. But for some, it's way too late. In 2021, a teenager died during an elevator malfunction in the old 4th Ward. Remember that story? And now a whistleblower has come forward with evidence that the building owners knew it was unsafe. He spoke exclusively with our Savannah Levins, who joins us now with the story that whistleblower provided me with documents. Knowing that, he was assigned to make repairs to the elevator, but tells me management refused because it was too expensive. That likely cost Jamarcus McFarland his life and may point to a bigger problem in our buildings. You wanna help, you have to go back. Body camera video shows firefighters attempting to rescue 18 year old Jamarcus McFarland from a malfunctioning elevator in this Highland Ave. building. Other riders escape as it drops, but McFarland became pinned between the top of the elevator and the floor. He died after an hour long attempt to save him. This is a tragic loss because we lost a good young man who had a bright, bright future. Attorney Sean Williams is representing the McFarland family in a lawsuit against the building's management saying that elevator was overdue for inspection. The owners of this building knew about this dangerous condition and had every opportunity prevented, so it just makes it even double worse. You lost your child, but it was preventable and now a whistleblower is coming forward saying the owners skipped. Fixes to save money. There have been no maintenance done whatsoever. The contractor asked that we protect his identity, but provided evidence showing he'd warned management the elevators were a life safety risk. And what was the response to that? Basically, no. Can you get more quotes so we can shop this around? I don't want to spend that type of money for this. You know, we can get it done cheaper. I emphatically told them that this is not something we can we have time to play with. This is something that has to be done. And done immediately. It's not something you can shop around. And while the repairs were being delayed, Jamarcus was killed. It was very, very tragic, but it was very, very preventable. There's no way to put a price on a life. And I think that's what was done. And what your whistleblower shows and proves is they made a conscious decision to save cost over the lives of people. We made numerous attempts over several weeks to contact the building management and owners, but never heard back. Williams says the McFarland family hopes to see real change come from this tragedy. We have millions of people every day in this state riding elevators, and if you don't make sure they're maintained in a proper way, this unfortunate situation can can come to somebody else's family and life. In Georgia, the fine for failing to keep an elevator inspection up to date is $500.00, which is nothing. You know, what's that life worth. Elevator operators have to request those annual inspections. It's not automatic. We uncovered 825 elevators in Atlanta alone are past due. There are codes in place to prevent this. But they just need to be enforced. We take a risk every time we're on the elevator. Our job on behalf of this family is to get them justice. Get your mark as justice, make sure his legacy live on, but to make sure that this doesn't happen to anybody else. We've learned a bill was previously introduced in Georgia to crack down on overdue inspections, including raising the fine from 500 to $2500, but it did not pass. We just reached out to the sponsors to ask if they plan to propose something similar again, but have not yet heard back. We'll keep you updated.

India's External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar has once again silenced Pakistan and critics of revocation of Article 370. title: J&K cops get Indian, Israeli and German-built weapons to combat terror in Kashmir - report
description:
In a first, the J&K police has inducted three state-of-the-art deadly weapons to combat terrorism. The police officers in the valley were given a high-tech, made-in-India Zen shootedge corner shot pistol. The weapon can facilitate shooting around corners and over walls without exposing the user to an anti-terrorist operation. Other weapons are  Tavor X-95, an Israeli-built assault rifle, and Germany's highly successful MP-5 rifle. A J&K police officer told PTI that modernising the force's arsenal was necessary to meet and combat increased security and counterterrorism challenges. Watch this video to know more.

title: India shows mirror to Pakistan at UN, condemns country for providing “safe haven to terrorists”
description:
India on February 23 exercised its ‘Right of Reply’ at UNGA against Pakistan and advised Islamabad to look at its track record as a state that provides safe havens to terrorists. At the United Nations General Assembly Eleventh Emergency Special Session, Indian Counsellor Pratik Mathur said, "Pakistan has only to look at itself and its track record as a State that harbours and provides safe havens to terrorists and does so with impunity." He also advised the Pakistani delegation to refer to the numerous Right of Replies that India has exercised in the past.

#Pakistan #UNGA #UN

title: India's BrahMos missiles get maiden buyer in Philippines; Boost for Indian defence exports
description: India has bagged a $374 million contract to supply BrahMos supersonic cruise missiles to the Philippines. This deal could pave way for more defence contracts with the Philippines and other ASEAN countries. The defence deal is unlikely to go down well with China but Beijing's aggressive behaviour in the disputed South China Sea has taken relations with the Philippines to a fresh low forcing the country to beef up its defence. transcription: now the Philippines has claimed that China is yet again creating Discord in the spratly Islands located in the South China Sea specifically targeting its titu Island which is also a major Military Base According to reports it has been under China's surveillance for some time now as territorial tensions mount in the area Philippines has claimed that it has spotted dozens of militia Vehicles along with the Chinese Navy ship around the contested tutu island in the South China Sea tattoo islands are reportedly occupied by Manila in the latest the Philippine Coast Guard has reported seeing 42 vessels in the vicinity of the tutu Island believed to be crude by the Chinese Maritime militia Personnel while the Chinese Navy vessel and Coast Guard ship were also observed slowly loitering in the surrounding Waters a tattoo in the spratly island China is manila's biggest and most strategically important Outpost in the South China Sea it is a body of water largely claimed by Beijing considered to be a tactically and resource-wise significant feature attracting several conflicting territorial claims by neighboring countries couple of weeks back while protesting against China's aggressive activities in the sea the Filipino president Marcus Jr said that the Philippines will not lose an inch of territory to its powerful neighbor home to over 400 people including military and law enforcement Personnel the island is used by Manila to maintain its territorial claim experts say China's fishing feat and Coast Guard are Central to its strategic Ambitions in the South China Sea maintaining a constant presence that complicates fishing and offshore energy activities for other Coastal States in a statement manila's Coast Guard called China's continuous presence in the region inconsistent with the right of innocent passage further calling it a blatant violation of the Philippines territorial Integrity last month Marcus Jr summoned the Chinese Ambassador and complained about the intensity and frequency of China's actions in the South China Sea so far the Philippines has filed 77 complaints against China's activities in the sea the number includes a claim regarding Chinese Coast Guard ship that directed a military-grade laser at a Philippine Coast Guard's ship which was on a supply Mission China claimed sovereignty over the spratly islands the surrounding countries of South China Sea Brunei Malaysia the Philippines Taiwan and Vietnam all have competing claims for the sum or all of the islands spratly Islands have been at the center of controversy for a long time as the Philippines Taiwan Vietnam are in very close proximity of the contentious Islands we are now available in your country download the app now get all the news on the move

title: US Military Gets Access to 4 More Philippine Bases
description:
The Philippines is forging closer military ties with the United States, granting U.S. forces access to an additional four military sites. As VOA’s Chris Casquejo explains, the enhanced partnership comes amid rising concerns over an increasingly aggressive China. Produced by Chris Casquejo
Originally published at - https://www.voanews.com/a/us-military-gets-access-to-4-more-philippine-bases/6950484.html

» Subscribe to VOA News: https://bit.ly/3KIPysi
» Watch more VOA News video: https://www.youtube.com/c/VOANews

Voice of America (VOA) is the largest U.S. international broadcaster, providing news and information in more than 40 languages to an estimated weekly audience of 236.8 million people. VOA produces content for digital, television, and radio platforms. It is easily accessed via your mobile phone and on social media. It is also distributed by satellite, cable, FM and MW, and is carried on a network of approximately 3,000 affiliate stations. 

Since its creation in 1942, Voice of America has been committed to providing comprehensive coverage of the news and telling audiences the truth. Through World War II, the Cold War, the fight against global terrorism, and the struggle for freedom around the globe today, VOA exemplifies the principles of a free press.

Connect with VOA News:

» VISIT OUR WEBSITE: https://www.voanews.com/
» LIKE OUR FACEBOOK PAGE: https://www.facebook.com/voiceofamerica
» FOLLOW US ON INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/voanews/
» FOLLOW US ON TWITTER:  https://twitter.com/VOANews
transcription: [Music] foreign under a new agreement the U.S will gain access to four more Philippine military bases in addition to the five the U.S already uses the U.S has put aside over 82 million dollars to upgrade the infrastructure at the Philippine bases I just want to be clear that we're not seeking permanent basing in the Philippines while the locations weren't announced Philippine officials in November announced that the U.S asked for access to military camps in Luzon in the northern part of the Philippines which is close to Taiwan the Philippines is also setting up their own Marine littoral regiment which will use Ramos missiles from India which will have about a 200 mile range so you can imagine scenarios in which these capabilities are useful in ranging Chinese vessels doing an amphibious Landing of Taiwan or block 80 in the island the Philippines could also Grant the U.S access to bases in Palawan along its western coast to help respond to disputes in the South China Sea modernizing that Alliance networking it more with the Japanese and the Australian alliances fits perfectly into this U.S overall strategy of leaning more heavily on its allies and making those alliances more equal China said the U.S move undermines Regional stability and raised tensions in the region China is now the Philippines largest trading partner and there are concerns the move could prompt Chinese economic retaliation I think this is where the Philippines will have to work with other countries in asean um to make sure that there would be some kind of uh support you know from other countries in asean as the Philippines try to do its share in terms of keeping stability in in a more turbulent picture there is some citizen opposition to an increased military presence in the region many protesters say an increased military presence threatens to surrender Philippine sovereignty to the United States Chris cascaho VOA news Washington

title: Govt. inaugurates Pag-asa island seaport
description:
Pag-asa island in the West Philippine sea now has a beaching ramp. The
hotly-contested island is part of the Spratly group of islands. The seaport is
just the beginning and the government has more plans there.
transcription: defense secretary Delfin lorenzana on a trip to the disputed pagasa island in the West Philippine Sea he is set to formally open the Navy's beaching ramp in the island sea transport can be tough at pagasa primarily due to the absence of a decent year vessels have to drop anchor about half a kilometer from the island passengers and their cargo need to be transferred to smaller boats that will bring them to the shore so in 2017 government finally decides to construct pagasa's own beaching ramp initially this project was targeted to be completed in a year but because of bad weather and rough sea conditions this took about two years to be finished but finally the residents of pagasa can enjoy the benefits of having their own beaching ramp bigger vessels especially Navy ships varying crucial Supply like food and other Provisions can now Dock at the island engineering equipment and construction supplies needed for the repair of pagasas dilapidated airstrip can now also be hauled in he sheltered Seaport built on another part of the island will also be inaugurated this week this is the project of the transportation department or fishermen and their fishing vessels can seek protection during stormy weather before the administration of President duterte why if people are not coming here often so foreign people coming here will be more frequent either civilian or government officials this is lorenzana's second trip to pagasa former Chinese Ambassador Zhao zhanwa had previously discouraged him from visiting the island but lorenzana carried on with the visit anyway Secretary of Defense both China and Vietnam also claim pagasa to be part of their territories pagasa has an international name titu Island belongs to the Philippines minutes before landing on the island lorenzana gets itex greeting which he rather finds amusing welcome to Vietnam other ranking military officials with him receive another greeting on their phones welcome to China well they ignored these text messages for lorenzana an idea came to mind setting up our own powerful cell sites in pagasa that will also send out these words welcome to the Philippines in pagasa Island David Santos CNN Philippines

title: North Korea fires ballistic missile towards Japan; Lands in Exclusive Economic Zone | Watch
description:
North Korea has fired a long-range missile from its capital into the sea off Japan, according to its neighbors, a day after it threatened to take strong measures against South Korea and the U.S. over their joint military exercises. Japan said no damage has been reported from the missile, which landed within Japan’s exclusive economic zone, about 200 kilometers (125 miles) west of Oshima island. Oshima lies off the western coast of the northernmost main island of Hokkaido. Watch this video for more.

title: HHI at Euronaval 2022: New OPVs and Corvettes for the Philippine Navy
description:
South Korean shipbuilder Hyundai Heavy Industries (HHI) had a strong presence at Euronaval 2022, with the CVX aircraft carrier project as the centerpiece of their booth.

=====================

K. S. Woo, Senior Vice President of marketing, Naval & Sepcial Ship Business  Unit, introduced HHI as the #1 shipbuilder in the world. We then focused on two ongoing programs for the Philippine Navy:
- HDP-2200 OPV
- HDF-3100 Corvette

Hyundai Heavy Industries signed a contract with the Philippine Department of National Defense on June 27, 2022 for six new 2,400 ton Offshore Patrol Vessels (OPV).

In December 2021, HHI announced it won an order to build two 3,200 ton class corvettes for the Philippine Navy.

=====================

title: EXCLUSIVE: UK ammo stockpiles proved 'inadequate' by war in Ukraine
description:
Whitehall sources have told Sky News that the UK is reviewing the size of its ammunition stockpiles because Russia's invasion of Ukraine has shown them to be far too small. 

Read more here: https://news.sky.com/story/pm-has-no-interest-in-defence-whitehall-sources-say-as-uk-ammo-stockpiles-proved-inadequate-by-war-in-ukraine-12817962

transcription: Western weapons in eastern Ukraine they're evening up the battlefield for Ukrainian troops against Russia's much larger Army but neither side stocks are infinite and a race is on to see who can re-arm fastest on Ukraine's front line near the city of bakmut a soldier explains how this makeshift cover protects his gun from Russian suicide drones he also talks about the need to preserve ammunition um the rate of artillery fire over the past year has been greater than at any time since the Korean War a Ukrainian officer has told Sky News that Russia had been firing 60 000 to 70 000 shells a day a level that's about halved as supplies ran down U.S officials have put that top rate at around 20 000 a day but also say it's dropped Ukraine by contrast has been firing five thousand to six thousand rounds daily as for the impact Russia has lost around 9 000 pieces of military equipment such as armored vehicles and artillery three times more than Ukraine with its tanks missiles and generosity the UK is one of the Ukrainian military's most important suppliers but for how long I've been told Britain is reviewing the size of its ammunition stockpiles because Russia's Invasion here has exposed how past assumptions on what would be needed to fight a war were far too conservative my sources say Richie sunac must increase defense spending to fund a massive expansion in ammunition and weapon stores or risk being unable to keep supporting Ukraine at the level needed rebuilding the UK's military strength after Decades of cuts is also critical the Prime Minister talked tough when he hosted Vladimir zelensky this month but one Whitehall Source accused Mr sunac of having no interest in defense and security those charged with that in number 10 can barely get access to him the president zelenski visit was engaged with late and with only peripheral passing interest if it's not domestic or economic it doesn't feature a Second Source said he's a financier and simply can't understand these things a government spokesperson said these claims are baseless and untrue it was the Prime Minister who as Chancellor agreed the 2020 spending review that provided the ministry of Defense with the largest increase in defense investment since the Cold War the prime minister is clear that we will do everything necessary to protect our people which is why our Armed Forces will always have the equipment and capability they need of course the UK is only one of many countries arming Ukraine but dwindling stockpiles is a common theme that needs fixing so the troops can keep firing their brain Sky News Kiev

title: U.S. and China increase military deployments in South China Sea, as tensions rise
description:
With President Trump''s tough stance on the legality of China''s claims to the South China Sea, military tensions between the two superpowers are brewing. On Friday, satellite imagery revealed an unprecedented eight Chinese PLA air-to-air and air-to-ship fighter jets on one of the Paracel Islands. The U.S. military has also confirmed that two long-range supersonic B-1B Lancers took off from the U.S. mainland for repositioning in Guam. The U.S. claims to be protecting its allies in the region, but its message for China is clear.

Two days ago, two U.S. carrier groups performed an exercise in the South China Sea, while on Friday satellite imagery revealed a bird''s eye view of Chinese air force deployments on Woody Island.  

On the island''s airstrip, eight Chinese jets could be seen lined up in a row. Foreign media have continually reposted the photographs, commenting that this was the first time for such a large contingent to be seen on the island. 

Smith Chen
Defense analyst
It''s true that the configuration of this deployment is totally different from what we have seen in the past. Fighter jets are deployed to maintain air superiority. Attack aircraft or bombers are used for anti-ship attacks and bombing missions. The Chinese navy and air force must be considering whether permanently stationing these aircraft on the island are worth the logistics costs. If not, they will likely use troop rotations to establish its presence on the island installation

Experts still do not rule out that China may make these kinds of deployments part of its regular operations in the region.  Its goal is nothing less than that of challenging the U.S. and gaining sovereignty over the sea. 

Websites devoted to exposing flight movements were replete with images on July 18 of two B-1B Lancers, long-range multi-mission supersonic conventional bombers, taking off  from a base in South Dakota, crossing the Pacific Ocean and landing in Guam for stationing, bringing the number of B-1Bs in Guam''s Anderson Air Force Base to four. The Indo-Pacific Command confirmed that this deployment was aimed at fulfilling U.S. defense commitments to its allies. These remarks were clearly aimed at China. 

Smith Chen
Defense analyst
China often says that they have their so-called Xian H-6 Strategic Bomber that, when coupled with CJ-10 cruise missiles, can threaten Guam. If China uses its fighter jets in the South China Sea region for harassment or to fly more often to the region than before, the U.S. aircraft repositioning will make it able to reach the South China Sea more quickly. Whether it''s utilizing its so-called Aegis Combat System or having B-1Bs depart from Guam, they can all reach the South China Sea region rapidly and this kind of operational flexibility will actually increase pressure on China.  

As China and the U.S. vie for influence in the South China Sea, Taiwan is paying attention from afar and is ready to respond to any possible development.

title: “It’s Modi Doctrine…,” EAM Jaishankar credits Prime Minister for India’s foreign policy shift
description:
During the inaugural session of the Asia Economic Dialogue 2023, India’s External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar was hailed for India’s foreign policy, however, he credited Prime Minister Narendra Modi for country’s strong diplomacy. When former Indian Ambassador Gautam Bambawale termed S Jaishankar as a rockstar for new brand of India’s foreign policy, External Affairs Minister was quick to credit his boss (PM Modi) for shift in policy.

President Xi Jinping met with his Philippine counterpart Rodrigo Duterte in Manila on November 20. Hundreds protested at the Chinese embassy against the nations’ closer relationship amid the ongoing South China Sea dispute.

percent and let me tell you this is not an original question Nobel prize-winning Economist James Heckman loves asking this question and what's the answer innate intelligence has a much smaller influence on success according to data less than two percent but if you don't want to look at data just look at your boss you don't have to be intelligent to be successful and the biggest earners may not be the brainiest recently a study was conducted in Sweden it found that higher intelligence is related to higher wages but only up to a point they've given a threshold of 57 300 in salary a lot of salary admittedly but this is the threshold beyond that the study says your ability plateaus but their wages may continue to rise and to prove this they took a standard ability test do you know what the result was the top one percent earner scored worse than those below them in other words the top bosses were technically not more deserving than those who earned half their wages so for all you know you could be the smartest person in the room though not with the highest salary and this invites some obvious questions if ability is not the driving force behind occupational success what is and if you're so smart why aren't you rich science unfortunately doesn't have a definitive answer but some Studies have tried their hand at solving this puzzle some say success is about luck others say family wealth plays a role and another key factor is personality which is a broad Factor really all of these abroad statements but they're talking about conscientiousness you know diligence perseverance self-discipline all of this makes a difference and then there's another surprising Factor your spouse's personality can influence your Career Success they say this is according to studies people with relatively prudent and reliable Partners tend to perform better at work but you could say you already knew all of this I'm sure you did but how do these studies help us then they make us think and question the system the process for instance should we stop fussing over IQ scores now a 2016 study says grades are better predictors of success than raw IQ scores after all grades reflect qualities like perseverance plus intelligence but then great matters only up to a point social skills and motivation also play a role an important role in career growth also here's a question that we must ask if the most wealthy are not the most intelligence intelligent can we really trust the decisions they make and I'm not talking about Elon Musk it's a general question there is growing income inequality in the society the richest one percent have nearly twice as much wealth as the rest of the world put together 26 trillion dollars to be exact billionaire fortunes are increasing by 2.7 billion dollars a day a billionaire gained roughly 1.7 million dollars for every one dollar earned by a person in the bottom 90 percent and this study was done in Sweden which has a relatively small wage Gap in 2021 Sweden's income inequality was 0.34 their highest in 50 years so think about other countries in West Asia and North Africa they have the worst income inequalities in the world maybe the gap between intelligence and wages is even more there and why is this important because the decisions that the top earners make have consequences for the rest of us they drive policy changes in corporations they also have political clout and the ability to influence policy so it's important to have the right people in top positions how do we ensure that perhaps by trying harder ourselves remember successful people are not born they're made

title: U.S. Air Force Personnel share their Filipino heritage
description: U.S. Air Force personnel from the 35th Fighter Wing proudly share their Filipino heritage! U.S. service members who were born in the Philippines do not forget who they are or where they came from. #FriendsPartnersAllies #MyFilAmStory
transcription:
So I am a flight surgeon for the 13th Fighter Squadron in Misawa Air Base. So what that entails is that I do primary care medicine for our flyers, in addition to other special duty personnel. My job in the Air Force is being a dedicated crew chief. That means I'm in charge of all the maintenance for the jets. Making sure that these are all airworthy. So I am a flight systems supervisor. And basically, I manage and maintain a lot of the computers down there. I love being in the Air Force because there's so many opportunities. Originally born from San Fernando, Pampanga. So I was originally born in the Philippines, in an area called Cavite. I actually grew up here in the Philippines, I grew up in Bicol. I get to eat the local food again. I know back in Guam there's a lot of Filipinos, but actually being here, where I was born, and eating the food they have around here, it's pretty great. So I'm pretty happy about it. The Philippines, for me, is very nostalgic. For one, even though I grew up in Tennessee where we have four seasons, it's almost like it's in my genes to really enjoy the warm weather
all year long. I fit in. I love the heat, you know? Like back at home station, back in Misawa, Japan, it's like all snowy. It's actually snowing there right now. So I'm loving it. The food is great, the people are great, I can speak the language, so I'm loving it. I'm, after this TDY (temporary duty), gonna go see my family for a reunion. I haven't seen them in over ten years, and there are 56 of them that are waiting to come greet me. So, I think for all those reasons, I really love the Philippines. Being back here in the Philippines, you always have to look back where you came from, and it's a good experience. If you know that your family is from---whether it be the Philippines or Europe, or wherever it may be, like really dig into it and learn more about it, because I think that, you know, there's something within all of us that we're probably missing out on. So I highly encourage you to just jump in there and learn more about it. Whether it be by reading or going out to that country, or eating the food,
whatever way you think you can get connected. In Tagalog, I just want to say, "Salamat (Thank you)" and, "Mabuhay (Long live) Filipino."

title: US gains access to more bases near China after deal with Philippines
description:
The United States has been granted access to more military bases on China's doorstep.

The US Defense Secretary announced a deal with his Filipino counterpart during his East Asia tour.

correspondent Brent O'Halloran reports it's one of several recent moves which has angered Beijing it was hardly a warm welcome Filipino protesters burnt flags and threw insults toward the visiting U.S official there to increase military ties and facilities in the country it will only serve to increase the tensions in the South China Sea and the Taiwan street but that's exactly what was agreed U.S defense secretary Lloyd Austin signed a deal to allow the U.S military access to four more Filipino bases it is a big deal it's a really big deal in that uh you know it gives us provides us the opportunity again to interact a bit more in an effective way it follows recent deals to increase the U.S military presence in Japan and add to the 28 000 American troops in South Korea while the U.S and South Korea on Thursday carried out joint air drills with Advanced bombers and stealth Fighters critics a these actions simply inflame tensions with China and North Korea and make war more likely deploying additional [Music] facilities which is between China and the United States China has denounced the United States recent military expansion in East Asia it claims the U.S is being dangerously provocative and so does North Korea its foreign Ministry says the recently announced increase in U.S war games has pushed things to an extreme Red Line this also won't sit well with Beijing taiwan's president hosted the former head of American forces in the region our discussions over the past few days have underscored taiwan's vibrant democracy and Civil Society this is seen as one of the median line over a 24-hour period prompting Taiwan to put its forces on alert brento Halloran Sky News in Taipei

title: Rare look at China's artificial island-building project
description: The U.S. says China is reclaiming land in the South China Sea. Artificial islands under construction could become military bases. China denied CBS News access, but Seth Doane got as close as any Westerner might.
transcription: we continue our look this morning on what China does not want you to see the United States says the superpower is reclaiming land in the South China Sea artificial islands under construction could become military bases China has not granted CBS News access but Seth Doane got as close as any Westerner might and he is in back in Beijing this morning Seth good morning good morning those territorial claims can be so scattered they almost appear like a game of Chinese checkers with different countries claiming different bits of land China will not let foreign journalists visit those Islands in the South China Sea so we traveled to the Philippines to try to find our own way to see that the patchwork of territorial claims may be best understood from the air a wreath belonging to China is close to an atoll claimed by Vietnam and not far from a shoal belonging to the Philippines we landed on PAGASA claimed by China inhabited by Filipinos and just 13 miles from subi reef one of the islands the Chinese have been creating okay so just hop in here there we hired some Filipino fishermen to take us as close as we could get thank you very much thank you one of the reasons the South China Sea is so valuable is that it has seven billion barrels of proven oil reserves that's the oil consumption of the entire United States for a year there are also the fisheries that provide these men with a living and busy shipping lanes that see five times more oil tanker traffic than the Panama Canal as we were first approaching subi reef here you could just see one crane now as we get closer you can see a number of cranes up and down the length of this island satellite images from early June reveal the pace of growth the landfill has expanded dramatically overall China is adding to its islands at the rate of at least three and a half acres a day it almost looks like a city in the middle of the sea there's enough space for an airstrip through the haze we could see the faint outline of heavy equipment and then a warning signal they've now flashed several warning signals at us our captain is starting to get nervous he tells us it's time to get out of here in calmer water our captain ramu lobar koma told us he felt it was too dangerous to get closer worried about being detained by the Chinese what was that signal that you saw why did you tell us we needed to turn back right away there's a nice pickle it was a warning for us not to go any further he said so I turned the engine down so we didn't look like we were moving closer gradually Suzuki back in Beijing we went to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to ask why our requests to see China's Island building have not been granted do you believe it's a possibility that we could visit these islands but is China hiding anything on these islands so far no one has been able to visit well without their needs have on the yard I can tell you for sure spokeswoman hua chunying said that the Chinese government has nothing to hide from the international community it was hard to see that warning light on the camera but through the haze we made it out sought at least five times flashing there this week China said it had stopped expanding some of the islands in the South China Sea but Charlie it would not stop building on that Seth thank you so much good reporting very good I think I would have stopped there too oh yeah when the captain says the Connie said far enough yeah I think about the implications of China building those acre those islands there three lot very significance the military significance yeah this is a big story

title: Rep. Schiff: House GOP wants ‘immunity for their party leader’
description:
Rep. Adam Schiff joins MSNBC’s Lawrence O’Donnell to discuss how the Republican defense of Trump shows the GOP is more interested in protecting Trump than the rule of law, which sets a “dangerous” precedent and holds Trump to a different standard: “If you do not hold him accountable, he will go on to do worse and worse and worse.”

title: Gravitas: Why are shelves empty in the UK?
description:
#GRAVITAS | Three of the UK’s largest supermarket chains have introduced limits for shoppers on several fresh produce lines, including tomatoes, cucumbers and peppers, as they try to prevent gaps from appearing on shelves. So what is going on and are the shortages going to spread to other retailers and foodstuffs? Molly Gambhir tells you.

#UK #FoodCrisis

About Channel: 

WION The World is One News, examines global issues with in-depth analysis. We provide much more than the news of the day. Our aim to empower people to explore their world. With our Global headquarters in New Delhi, we bring you news on the hour, by the hour. We deliver information that is not biased. We are journalists who are neutral to the core and non-partisan when it comes to the politics of the world. People are tired of biased reportage and we stand for a globalised united world. So for us the World is truly One.

transcription: I'm speaking of food shortages the UK is dealing with them as well a cost of living crisis fares of a recession empty shelves but what exactly is going on what is behind this why is there a shortage of fruits and vegetables our next report getting you the complete story two of the biggest supermarkets in the United Kingdom Morrisons in Asta have limited the sales of their fresh produce the purchase of perishables like tomatoes potatoes cucumbers Peppers lettuce and broccoli has been restricted as inflation soars every customer is allowed to buy only two or three of these items and not more but the big question remains why is there a shortage of fruit and vegetables in the United Kingdom who is to be blamed and the answer lies in the extreme weather conditions in Europe and North Africa the volume of fruits from Morocco has been most affected as Growers have been battling cold temperatures heavy rain and flooding over the past three to four weeks the change seems to have affected the ripening of tomatoes further forcing Ferry cancellations and deliveries but Morocco is not alone Spain is also on the list and the conditions are so bad that this year the Tomato produce was recorded at least 22 percent lower than what it was in February last year but is it only about the weather conditions there's also the issue of brexit and energy prices going up this is making British Farmers struggle the increasing gas prices since Russia's invasion of Ukraine largely affected the United Kingdom making its Farmers struggle and Grow Limited produce to keep the costs down the result has been empty shelves in supermarkets but for how long will the shortage last will the UK be able to recover from this crisis there is no good news on that front report suggest that the problem is expected to magnify and the shortages are expected to last for weeks to come however in the meantime chains of supermarkets are in touch with farmers and are doing everything to ensure that customers are able to access a wide range of fresh produce the ongoing crisis has pushed the British government under the radar while some criticize the government for failing to protect the UK Farmers from rising energy costs the Farmers Union took a dig at the British Royals and said that the Royal botany Gardens were better protected than the vegetable Growers themselves view report Beyond world is one we are now available in your country download the app now get all the news on the move

title: PH Senators' meeting with EU counterparts turns 'intense' over ICC probe | The Final Word
description:
Some Philippine senators sit down with their European Union counterparts for a dialogue on human rights, and among the topics was the International Criminal Court’s probe into the Duterte administration’s war on drugs.

And as Eimor Santos tells us, the discussion turned intense according to one senator.
transcription: six members of the European Parliament arrived early at the Philippine Senate to meet with their Filipino counterparts the media were allowed inside the venue before the closed-door meeting began senate committee on justice and human rights chairman Francis Tolentino presided an hour later Senator and former Philippine national police chief Bato De la Rosa left the meeting and went straight to the hearing on marawi Rehabilitation here he disclosed that it was an intense dialogue with the European lawmakers the discussion was so intense that I cannot live I have to defend our sovereignty De la Rosa says a Spanish lawmaker questioned the proposed resolution seeking to defend former president Rodrigo duterte from the international criminal courts drug war probe automation that is too much of tinkering with our intern the foreign lawmaker only had the racist voice for the sake of The Interpreter in a joint press conference Tolentino and the European delegation call the discussion fruitful and constructive in the end they still had different opinions about the icc's investigation in the Philippines Sovereign we see right now prosecution starting but being rather slow with at least 6 000 people killed in the warned rocks only 20 cases found and three people convicted we as the European Union are member of the Rome statute we support the ICC and we see this as a potential to support the investigations into the killings the European delegation also invited opposition Senator Reese antiviros for a separate meeting antivero sees the European Union's respect for the Philippines and hopes our government would also listen to the International Community in the first place and we presume mutual respect kapagami internal challenges positive reinforcement even of some kind of fraternal pressure nah foreign one of the alleged human rights victims under duterte is a staunch critic detained former Senator Lila De Lima the European delegation plans to visit her on Thursday Amor Santos CNN Philippines

title: Man claims winning $2.04 billion Powerball jackpot was stolen from him
description: A man is claiming the record-setting $2.04 billion Powerball jackpot ticket sold at an Altadena service station was stolen from him and is now attempting to sue the person who claimed the jackpot. Full story: https://abc7.com/california-lottery-powerball-204-billion-jackpot-lawsuit/12867779/
transcription: DAVID: THE CALIFORNIA LOTTERY ANNOUNCED THE IDENTITY OF LAST YEAR'S $2 BILLION POWERBALL LOTTERY, BUT NOW THERE'S SOMEONE ELSE CLAIMING THE TICKET WAS STOLEN FROM HIM. CARLOS: IT'S THE BIGGEST POWERBALL JACKPOT IN HISTORY AND NOW THERE COULD BE A DISPUTE OVER WHO BOUGHT THE WINNING TICKET AT JOE'S GAS STATION HERE IN ALTADENA. >> THE NAME OF THE PERSON WHO IS THE ONLY PLAYER TO MATCH ALL 6 NUMBERS OF THE HISTRORIC POWERBALL LAST NOVEMBER IS EDWIN CASTRO. CARLOS: THE LOTTERY ANNOUNCED EDWIN CASTRO AS THE WINNER OF THE BIG PRIZE AND THAT HE WOULD COLLECT A LUMP SUM PAYMENT OF $997 MILLION. CASTRO DID NOT SHOW UP TO THE ANNOUNCEMENT. >> OUR WINNER DECLINED THE OPPORTUNITY TO BE WITH US TODAY. CARLOS: THERE IS NOW A POTENTIAL LAWSUIT THAT CLAIMS A MAN NAMED JOSE RIVERA ACTUALLY PURCHASED THE TICKET. IN THE PAPERWORK RIVERA CLAIMS THAT ANOTHER MAN IDENTIFIED ONLY AS REGGIE STOLE THE TICKET AND WOULD NOT GIVE IT BACK. RIVERA SAYS AFTER THE WINNING NUMBERS WERE SELECTED HE KEPT ASKING TO GET THE TICKET BUT REGGIE REFUSED. HE CLAIMS REGGIE THREATEEND TO DESTROY THE TICKET IF HE DIDN'T SPLIT THE WINNINGS. THE DOCUMENT SAYS RIVERA REPORTED ALL OF THIS TO LAW ENFORCEMENT AND THE CALIFORNIA LOTTERY. THE LOTTERY HAS CLAIMED IT SOMETIMES LOOKS AT SURVEILLANCE VIDEO TO MAKE SURE IT HAS THE RIGHT PERSON. TODAY AT JOES SERVICE STATION NO ONE WOULD TALK TO US TO CONFIRM IF THE LOTTERY HAD CHECKED ITS VIDEO FROM BACK IN NOVEMBER. THE LOTTERY ISSUED A STATEMENT WHICH SAYS IN PART THE CALIFORNIA LOTTERY IS NOT AUTHORIZED TO INVESTIGATE CRIMINAL ACTIVITY AMONG ITS PLAYERS: SUCH ALLEGATIONS ARE SUBJECT TO INVESTIGATION ONLY BY LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT. FURTHER, WHEN IT COMES TO THE VETTING PROCESS FOR BIG WINNERS, CALIFORNIA LOTTERY HAS THE UTMOST CONFIDENCE IN ITS PROCESS FOR DOING SO. CALIFORNIA LOTTERY REMAINS CONFIDENT THAT EDWIN CASTRO IS THE RIGHTFUL WINNER. THE LAWSUIT NAMES THE STATE LOTTERY, EDWIN CASTRO AND REGGIE AS DEFENDANTS. THE LOTTERY SAYS ITS ROLE WOULD BE LIMITED IN ANY INVESTIGATION IT COULD ANSWER QUESTIONS AND MAYBE PROVIDE EVIDENCE THAT

title: Putin's troops shoot down U.S-made drones; Russia foils Ukraine attack in Moscow, Zaporizhzhia
description:
The ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine is escalating into an all-out drone war. Moscow says it has downed an explosives-laden Ukrainian drone in the town of Kireyevsk. Russian authorities say at least three people were injured in an explosion and several apartments were reportedly damaged after the drone was brought down. Meanwhile, in Zaporizhzhia, Russian troops shot down U.S-made drones using rifles. Russian authorities claim the drones were allegedly used to drop canisters of chemical weapons at its troops deployed. Watch this video for details.

#russia #ukraine #russiaukrainewar #russiaukrainecrisis #russiaukraine #russiaukraineconflict #drone #russiadrones #ukrainedrone #putin #bakhmut #moscow #zaporizhzhya

title: Joe Biden EXPRESSES CONCERN over Vladimir Putin's move to station nukes, calls it dangerous | WION
description:
The claimed intention of Russian President Vladimir Putin to place nuclear weapons in Belarus' neighbouring country was denounced by US President Joe Biden on Tuesday as "dangerous" language. At the White House, Biden told reporters, "This is a dangerous kind of discourse and it's disturbing."
Earlier, NATO condemned President Vladimir Putin's decision to deploy its tactical nuclear weapons in its neighbouring country Belarus. Putin made this announcement, as per Russian media reports, this will be the first time since the mid-1990s that Moscow would be stationed in such arms outside its territory. 

#NATO #RussiaUkraineWar #WIONLive

WION The World is One News examines global issues with in-depth analysis. We provide much more than the news of the day. Our aim is to empower people to explore their world. We are journalists who are neutral to the core and non-partisan when it comes to world politics. People are tired of biased reportage and we stand for a globalized united world. title: 36 states on alert as winter storms move in l GMA
description:
A massive winter storm wreaked havoc for millions across the United States, leaving at least 900,000 homes without power.
READ MORE: https://abcn.ws/3XWZu6I


#abcnews #blizzard  #snowstorm #storm
transcription: Coast to Coast winter storms 60 million Americans are on alert for extreme weather and it's the first blizzard warning for Los Angeles County in more than 30 years let's go to Trevor alt he is in snow covered Minneapolis good morning Trevor good morning Robin snow covered is absolutely right overnight here in Minnesota we were absolutely pummeled by the snow and it's really coming down heavily right now but it's not just how much snow we're getting it's also the kind of snow too I mean look at this look how powdery and fluffy this snow is this is exactly the kind of snow that's going to get blown across the road it's making visibility really difficult the driving conditions in some spots are almost impossible to the point they shut down several highways overnight but this is not just a Minnesota problem there is severe weather happening all over the country overnight a massive winter storm wreaking havoc for millions of people across the United States at least 900 000 without power more than eight hundred thousand in the Great Lakes region alone systems showing no mercy heavy winds and white out conditions pummeling the West icy roads and snow causing this massive 20 vehicle pile up in California at least eight people were injured the National Weather Service issuing a blizzard warning for the southern mountains in L.A County for the first time since 1989 in Washington State Road shut down from the heavy snow and poor visibility this school bus stranded and a major snowstorm threatening central Arizona with winds as high as 72 miles an hour Midwest also getting pummeled already hundreds of flights canceled today because of the weather in Michigan a volunteer firefighter killed by a fallen power line after ice snapped a tree branch winter storm battering Minnesota with a National Weather Service also issued a warning for near impossible travel conditions and an Illinois rain and Ice damaging the power system all of a sudden I heard a big boom and a big red fire came up in the South authorities in Arkansas saying five people were killed in a small plane crash in Little Rock while the cause is still under investigation wind gusts were reportedly 40 miles an hour when the incident happened and in the East a tornado touching down in New Jersey this video showing a trampoline flying through the air amid those strong winds foreign Minneapolis we're in the final throws of this storm officials have said this morning could actually be the most difficult time to drive through the morning commute we could still get another one or two inches of snow per hour Michael everybody be safe out there thank you hi everyone George Stephanopoulos here thanks for checking out the ABC News YouTube channel if you'd like to get more videos show highlights and watch live event coverage click on the right over here to subscribe to our Channel and don't forget to download the ABC News app for breaking news alerts thanks for watching

title: Filipino and American soldiers participate in military exercises
description:
The Philippines and US are holding their largest-ever joint military exercises.
Thousands of soldiers from both countries are taking part in the week-long drills.
Al Jazeera's @Jamela Alindogan reports from Cagayan, the Philippines.

transcription: al jazeera's invited on a tour a showcase of combined u.s and philippine fire power here in the northern province of kagayan 550 kilometers from taiwan a scenario is being played out the philippine marines are defending the country's coastal waters from imagined foreign incursions with the help of american troops it is a test of combat readiness in tarlac another northern philippine province large-scale drills of live fire maneuvers and aircraft assaults are held that is to ensure that the american and philippine military capabilities are synchronized in the event of an armed attack this is how balikatan or shoulder to shoulder exercises look up close certainly the objective of what we're doing is demonstrating the strength of the alliance as well as the commitment to regional security and that is the purpose of this exercise the balikatan is one of the most visible manifestations of the mutual defense treaty which was signed in 1951 and this year's exercise is proving to be one of its biggest with nearly nine thousand soldiers from both countries with the philippines and china both claiming the spratly islands and beijing and regional neighbors also claiming other disputed islands and reefs tensions have been raised in a region already considered a possible security flashpoint some officials say the philippine military needs to beef up its coastal defense capabilities if we talk of external aggression because sabina and we count 53 years that we've been doing for audito salon so it's high time nasigura with the unfolding events and internationally this year's exercises show how far president rodrigo duterte has walked back on his initial promise to scale down u.s military activities in the country with growing tensions in the south china sea both the u.s and the philippine military say they need to stay alert and any military that fails to evolve over time will eventually fail to defend its own nation jamella province northern philippines

title: Why Cuba’s Streets Are Filled With Classic Cars
description:
About 60,000 classic cars fill the streets of Cuba, and a trip isn't complete without a ride. Cubans have used their ingenuity to keep these decades-old cars on the streets.

------------------------------------------------------

#Cuba #ClassicCars #Insider

INSIDER is great journalism about what passionate people actually want to know. That’s everything from news to food, celebrity to science, politics to sports and all the rest. It’s smart. Why Cuba’s Streets Are Filled With Classic Cars
transcription: [Music] scroll through Havana's Instagram geotag and you'll see countless photos of colorful cogs the streets of Cuba are teeming with 60,000 classic American cars and it's an iconic experience for the islands visitors a majority of tourists can tell a story about riding down the malecon in a hot pink Chevy Belair or driving through havana city center and a baby blue Cadillac but how do these classic cars get there and more importantly why did they stay in the 1940s and 1950s Cuba had a strong urban middle class and this class had a passion for American cars Cuba imported over a hundred and twenty five thousand American cars and at one point Havana was considered the Cadillac capital of the world shortly after Fidel Castro came to power in 1959 a ban was placed on imported cars and car parts American tourism to Cuba came to a halt and one point four million Cubans left the country leaving behind their families homes and cars these abandoned cars were passed on to family or friends and became prized possessions with owners who are willing to do whatever it takes to keep them on the road Cubans turned to their ingenuity parts from tractors or lawnmowers became makeshift engines and shampoo turned into brake fluid the cars are a symbol of hard work but they're also a source of income a Cuban driver can make more in an hour than a Cuban doctor makes in a month [Music] our producer who visited her Cuban family in May 28 so the links families were willing to take to keep their cars running being a driver in Cuba is a career path that's one of the few career paths that allows you to kind of make your own money and not depend solely on the government providing it for you so it is a very lucrative business it is also a huge investment it was definitely not what I envisioned when I was scrolling through Instagram trying to get inspiration and travel photo ideas it just gave me a better appreciation of the ingenuity involved and the determination involved I definitely suggest you know getting that experience and driving in the classic cars but I think it's it's super important to remember that your photo op is their way of life for tourists it's not just a way to get from point A to point B riding in a classic car is an experience and an hour long ride can cost anywhere from twenty-five to forty dollars gran Flanagan another one of our producers travel to Cuba in 2015 I knew that there were gonna be a lot of beautiful classic cars but I thought there would be kind of mixed into a bunch of regular modern cars I was blown away by just how many of these cars there are just one of the most unique and colorful characteristics of the city I would absolutely recommend that if you're going to Cuba you need to hop in one of these cars and go for a ride and explore the city explore the city of Havana get off the beaten path I can still smell that unforgettable smell of all of that fuel exhaust walking the streets of Havana [Music] you

title: America's Navy - Enlisted vs. Officer
description:
Every job in the Navy carries tremendous importance for the success of the fleet.

As an Officer, it will be your responsibility to ensure the mission is accomplished by making the tough decisions in coordinating and planning.

As an Enlisted Sailor, you will be called upon to execute key functions that will determine the outcome of the task at hand.

Whichever your path, the Navy has opportunities to further your abilities and make you the best that you can possibly be.
If you want to find out how you can be a part of America's Navy, go here: http://www.navy.com/joining/ways-to-join.html

Ready for a career in the U.S. Navy?  Check out our U.S. Navy Careers page here: http://www.navy.com/careers.html

Want to see more from America's Navy?  Check out our YouTube channel here: https://www.youtube.com/user/UnitedStatesNavy

Want to follow us on social?  Find us here:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/americasnavy

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/americasnavy/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/AmericasNavy
transcription:
Both officer and enlisted have a certain amount of roles and responsibilities and authorities. Officers make the decisions and really make a lot of the coordinations and planning. And that comes down to us, and we make whatever they decide go. It’s our job to take charge, to make sure our personnel are being handled property and all their needs are being met, and ensuring our mission is being accomplished. My name is Lieutenant Commander Daniel Morales, and I am an officer in the United States Navy. My name is Petty Officer First Class Steven DesRoches, and I’m an enlisted sailor in the United States Navy. The requirements that a candidate must
meet before becoming an officer in the United States Navy is that they must
have a four year degree from an accredited university meet the physical
requirements and meet all the legal requirements. For the enlisted, you must meet the physical requirements, the legal requirements and be at least 17 years old with a high school diploma or equivalent. Candidates could start developing their leadership and management skills. They are going to be required to work under pressure and they're going to need to be able to
start learning the Navy's core values which are honor courage and commitment. Exactly. Time management is a very big skill and you can definitely learn that in college and on the job in the Navy. You definitely are challenged many times to be able to perform to your optimum under a variety of conditions and you will learn that extremely well in the Navy. You will learn how to be a manager, but more
importantly you learn how to multitask. As Petty Officer DesRoches can attest, being
in the Navy is a very dynamic and you have to be
able to multitask. Have the discipline to do that is going to be an extreme asset to you when you go for any job really. Becoming a leader is knowing your people and definitely knowing how to work different types of people work with different types of people to and over again. I think that the Navy will teach you not only the basics of
time management and knowing yourself but the leadership principles of knowing
your people. It's a based on mutual respect between the officer and enlisted. As far as
you and your day to day function. The officer is there and they're setting the example and setting forth what needs to happen. The enlisted is supposed to follow. Being able to carry out the work but be comfortable for me to be able to
approach him with an issue, or he should be able to be comfortable
enough certainly to come to me with an issue what needs to happen. Right. And furthermore, it's the officer will
take on their role at times as to provide that guidance and
leadership and even mentorship. It unlimited possibility whether you're coming in as an officer
or an enlisted. Being in the Navy is a way of life. It’s really just not
a job. It’s a call of duty. It's a something that someone could
really learn and develop within foster characteristics that you really can't
get anywhere else in the civilian sector. Definitely. Coming into the Navy not only gives you that technical expertise of a job that for me, I love my job. It's given me technical expertise to be able to do
that and a couple different fields. But it's also give me camaraderie, the sense of self, character, discipline and more opportunities, like Lt. Commander Morales was saying, you know, that I can handle College, advancement, benefits. I mean, I’m just overwhelmed. thank you for watching this Navy webcast. If you have any questions, visit Navy.com or find us on Facebook.

title: Meet First Female Filipina F-16 Fighter pilot, Lockheed's Test pilot, Wife & Mom: Monessa Balzhiser
description:
Meet Captain Monessa Catuncan Balzhiser: The First Female Filipina F-16 Fighter Pilot Of The US Air Force & Lockheed's F-16 Test Pilot
Monessa’s job inside the cockpit of an F-16 fighter jet is busy and dangerous. 
A Pilot's Perspective: Lifesaving Auto GCAS Technology:
Thankfully, innovative systems like the Automatic Ground Collision Avoidance System (Auto GCAS) have been developed to reduce risks and help eliminate the leading cause of F-16 pilot fatalities –  crashing an undamaged aircraft into the ground.

title: Homes in Brighton, Utah buried after getting over 500 inches of snow with more on the way
description:
Residents in Brighton said they've seen over 500 inches of snow already this season — and more is on its way.

While snow this high is no surprise to them, they said this is the most snow they've seen in a decade.

Mayor Dan Knopp also serves as the town's snow removal service.

title: “No country can prosper if its basic industry is terrorism...” EAM Jaishankar’s dig at Pakistan
description:
External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar on February 23 attended the Inaugural Session of the Asia Economic Dialogue 2023 in Pune, Maharashtra. During the media interaction, EAM Jaishankar said that India-Pak’s relationship’s fundamental issue is of terrorism and that no country will ever come out of a difficult situation and become a prosperous power if its basic industry is terrorism. During the media interaction at the inaugural session of the Asia Economic Dialogue 2023 in Pune today, he said, “The reality of this relationship is that it has a fundamental issue that we cannot and must not avoid is of terrorism. A country has to fix its economic issue, a country has to fix its political issue and social issue too. No country is ever going to come out of a difficult situation and become a prosperous power if its basic industry is terrorism.” He also said, “But, it’s an equal fact that any county that gets into a serious economic problem that country has to make policy, choices, and governance decisions to get themselves out of it. Another neighbour, non- neighbour or another institution, others cannot solve a problem if you are not prepared to solve it yourself. Any country in deep economic difficulties has to come out of it through what the world can do is to provide options and support systems. The country must fix its social and political issues. If I plan any scheme or decision for a country, I must also consider the people’s perspective. What they want, they (Pakistan) must think about this. If any country faces a deep economic crisis, not only Pakistan but other countries too. They must fix their plans and decisions in the favour of people.”

#SJaishankar #Pakistan #Maharashtra

transcription: hello folks welcome to Kudlow I'm Larry Kudlow remember back a couple of months ago when mainstream media types were saying the new Republican Congress wouldn't get anything done and really wasn't all that important Well turns out just after a few months the GOP Congress is important and is getting things done any number of things one of the things the House Republicans are doing to rescue the economy is to put together the lower energy cost act hr-1 which is scheduled for a Thursday vote this by itself is a very big deal it will lower inflation and it will increase growth it's going to turn the fossil fuels bigots back on with permitting reform opening the door for critical minerals a return to the One Federal decision approach of the Trump years reopening the door to the Keystone XL pipeline streamlining the Clean Water Act producing fertilizer to get food prices back down promoting LNG exports and any number of related things as I've said many times before we find petroleum refined petroleum products which have become very costly under Biden's war against fossil fuels permeate virtually every nook and cranny of the economy and by the way permitting reform in hr1 will help Renewables that's right it will allow the production of minerals for electric vehicle batteries without having to rely on China which is what interior secretary Deb Allen acknowledged today that the U.S does rely on China can't have that this bill would stop it Joe Biden's already threatened to veto it that shows how important the bill is in fact that tells you what a positive impact it would have on the economy Biden veto is always a leading indicator of decline anyway the Republican Congress is doing a lot of other things oversight committees on censorship parents education Hunter Biden's laptop the weaponization of Joe Biden's federal law enforcement all these excesses are being investigated now the Ways and Means Committee looking at tax cuts the new budget committee drawn up a pro-growth balance budget plan in other words a GOP beehive of activity of course Joe Biden still in denial about Republican conservative principles coming out of the house so for example just today speaker Kevin McCarthy turning up the heat on Biden to have a second meeting to discuss a new debt ceiling with additional budget savings just as in the past the two are inexorably linked speaker McCarthy emphasized the best way to reduce the national debt is to limit spending save taxpayer money and grow the economy he has offered to sit down and discuss a variety of means with Biden but so far Biden won't cooperate I want personally how I want to speaker McCarthy's points he suggested the importance of strengthening work requirements that was enacted under President Bill Clinton and then Senator Joe Biden voted for it work fair is such an important principle it is essential to the American ideal of the Dignity of work to climb the ladder of opportunity we've seen a lot of polls recently Sean tremendous voter pessimism on the economy on traditional American values like patriotism religion child-bearing culture but the root of all these social issue problems seems to be closely linked to a declining economy besotted with high inflation energy Independence is a tremendous first step out of this malaise a strong budget deal coupled with debt ceiling adjustment with calm financial markets and promote economic growth so the question is tonight why is Joe Biden resisting about that that's my riff

title: Ohio Train Derailment: Residents Are Frustrated Over Chemical Spill Response | WSJ
description:
Some East Palestine residents have returned home after being ordered to leave after a train carrying hazardous chemicals derailed there earlier this month. 

WSJ’s Kris Maher reports from the small Ohio town, where frustration is mounting over a lack of information.

Photo: Gene J. Puskar/AP

0:00 East Palestine residents are hesitant to return home after train derailment
2:00 Vinyl choride, the chemical released into air, is linked to higher risk of liver cancer
2:39 EPA visits and says air and water are safe

#Ohio #TrainDerailment #WSJ
transcription:
- [Kris Maher] I've been in
East Palestine this week, talking to residents who
were forced to evacuate after a derailment of a
Norfolk Southern train on February 3rd. Residents were told that
they could return home. But since they've been back, many have concerns about
being back in their homes, and they're concerned about smells and the potential for health effects from chemicals that were
released during the derailment. Right now, there's sort of, just this kind of cloud of concern that's hanging over the town.
(wind chimes ring) (soft staccato music) On Friday, February 3rd, around 9 p.m., a Norfolk Southern train derailed in the small village of
East Palestine, Ohio, which is on the border with Pennsylvania. As soon as the derailment occurred, police and other officials
came through the town and told people that they
had to evacuate immediately. (sirens blaring) Monday, February 6th, Norfolk Southern said that it would have
to breach five tanker cars containing vinyl chloride, to prevent a potentially
catastrophic explosion. - I honestly feel that the Palestine, the police department,
the fire department, all the first responders, they don't have the answers to give us because I don't think they know. They're not getting the
straight answers either. - [Kris] Residents in East
Palestine and surrounding areas packed the school gymnasium
Wednesday night to seek answers. - We're trying to get
information out to our citizens. Everybody's concerned, I'm concerned. But, you know, it's not
Norfolk Southern here. It's the EPA, the people who
have been working with us, trying to get our citizens
back into their homes safe. - We find it very hard to believe that there is no particulate map. - It was just a big runaround. Like, I feel like a lot of
the questions that were asked were people's rantings, and just speaking in circles. The answers that were given were things that we've already been told. - [Kris] Norfolk Southern
declined to send representatives to the town hall, citing safety concerns. The railroad said it has
distributed $1.5 million directly to more than 1,000 families,
and some businesses, and has established a $1 million fund available immediately to the community. One of the chemicals released
in the train derailment was vinyl chloride, which the National Cancer Institute says is associated with a higher
risk of liver cancer. Federal and state environmental regulators say they're going to continue
to monitor the air quality and water in the area, to ensure that it's safe for citizens. - What we have discovered through the testing and
sampling that's been done is that very early on, you know, we have estimated, based on our sampling and
modeling, about 3500 dead fish across that space, across those streams,
tributaries, waterways. - [Kris] The administrator for the US Environmental Protection Agency visited Thursday. - Let me be clear. EPA will exercise our oversight and our enforcement
authority under the law to be sure we are getting the results that the community deserves. - [Kris] So far, the EPA has said that air monitoring has
showed no levels of concern from chemicals released into the air. The EPA has also said that the water is safe to
drink in East Palestine from the municipal water facility. - This is so much bigger
than just it in the water. Our environment, our wildlife animals, our farmers that have
to till their soil up. - [Kris] Many residents want
testing inside their homes, which is being done. But even when it is being done, they're still kind of distrustful about those results at this point. (soft staccato music)

transcription: [Music] foreign [Music] it is about 6 30 p.m central time on Saturday evening this is Rolling Fork Mississippi and this is less than 24 hours since this massive tornado came in and I just want to give you all a first perspective as to what I am seeing here on the ground you can see look at this vehicle here the entire top smashed down by the force and look at that all smashed in as I turn the camera again and walk into all of this debris uh right now [Music] and you see all of this home just crushed and mangled by this storm [Music] Foundation of someone's home and these sides of this home a completely collapsed you see a drone above me [Music] foreign [Music] [Music] but I think it was only probably a minute or two and it was gone and we came out of the tub and what did you see Darkness darkness and debris just a lot of stuff everywhere everything you work for is gone but I do it all my life yeah we've got two still missing oh gosh I'm animal control for the city but I also wrong with that point I can't remember okay and everybody else found a couple of them last night that I couldn't find so they were all out here I'm just glad that they're safe I mean is this difficult to look at yeah it's bad yeah this is a very bad scene of one person from the National Weather Service saying that this is one of the worst that they have seen as far as assessment on the ground [Music] so this assessment will continue the cleanup you could hear already there are many casualties and injuries and uh as the sun goes down here on Saturday evening you're not far from the Mississippi River people are Mourning they're assessing and they're trying to do their best to step forward and I leave you with this progress already in the aftermath of this horrific and deadly tornado [Music] I'm Amy Freeze welcome to Fox weather's YouTube page we have more great videos on the way so make sure to subscribe to stay updated on all things weather
